trans-unit.source: Post-apocalyptic literature, movies, and games are a subgenre of science fiction that focuses on the dystopia that follows the fall of civilization. Strictly speaking, post-apocalyptic stories take place after the end of the world. At least, the end of the world for most people. Players take the role of the survivors (or their descendants) trying to persevere in the face of immense hardship. Popular post-apocalyptic scenarios include those set after nuclear war, in the aftermath of a zombie plague, in the months and years following an alien invasion, or after the environment collapses in the face of human overpopulation. Other ways the world could end include a massive meteorite strike, the long-awaited robot uprising, a powerful solar flare that burns out the world’s power grids and communications, or even something as prosaic as a global disease pandemic.
trans-unit.target: Post-apocalyptic literature, movies, and games are a subgenre of science fiction that focuses on the dystopia that follows the fall of civilization. Strictly speaking, post-apocalyptic stories take place after the end of the world. At least, the end of the world for most people. Players take the role of the survivors (or their descendants) trying to persevere in the face of immense hardship. Popular post-apocalyptic scenarios include those set after nuclear war, in the aftermath of a zombie plague, in the months and years following an alien invasion, or after the environment collapses in the face of human overpopulation. Other ways the world could end include a massive meteorite strike, the long-awaited robot uprising, a powerful solar flare that burns out the world’s power grids and communications, or even something as prosaic as a global disease pandemic.

trans-unit.source: SUGGESTED TYPES FOR A POST-APOCALYPTIC GAME
trans-unit.target: SUGGESTED TYPES FOR A POST-APOCALYPTIC GAME

trans-unit.source: Characters who play out the apocalypse itself or who have just survived it and must pick up a few hours, days, or months after the end should choose from an alternate slate of roles. If you begin your game in such a setting, it makes much more sense to let your players choose roles for characters in a modern game.
trans-unit.target: Characters who play out the apocalypse itself or who have just survived it and must pick up a few hours, days, or months after the end should choose from an alternate slate of roles. If you begin your game in such a setting, it makes much more sense to let your players choose roles for characters in a modern game.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the descriptors in the Cypher System Rulebook, you can widen the options available to the players, allowing them to choose from the descriptors presented here for their characters. A subset of the descriptors in this chapter are species descriptors, which may or may not be appropriate for your players, depending on your setting.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the descriptors in the Cypher System Rulebook, you can widen the options available to the players, allowing them to choose from the descriptors presented here for their characters. A subset of the descriptors in this chapter are species descriptors, which may or may not be appropriate for your players, depending on your setting.

trans-unit.source: Standard: Bitter, Hopeful, Rusted, Shiny Species: Canien, Felis, Flutter, Mutant
trans-unit.target: Standard: Bitter, Hopeful, Rusted, Shiny Species: Canien, Felis, Flutter, Mutant

trans-unit.source: Someone you cared for wronged you. They may have done so directly by betraying a trust, stealing your supplies, or giving you up to raiders to save their own life. Maybe they did it indirectly by going missing or dying on you. Or maybe it was an organization or institution that let you down. Whatever it was, you’ve spent a lot of time pulled into yourself, paranoid and mistrustful of others. But something’s happened lately that has at least opened you to the possibility of trusting others again. Maybe you have to work with someone else or die. Alternatively, perhaps you’ve decided to try one more time, despite your disillusionment. It’s either that or fully give in to bitterness.
trans-unit.target: Someone you cared for wronged you. They may have done so directly by betraying a trust, stealing your supplies, or giving you up to raiders to save their own life. Maybe they did it indirectly by going missing or dying on you. Or maybe it was an organization or institution that let you down. Whatever it was, you’ve spent a lot of time pulled into yourself, paranoid and mistrustful of others. But something’s happened lately that has at least opened you to the possibility of trusting others again. Maybe you have to work with someone else or die. Alternatively, perhaps you’ve decided to try one more time, despite your disillusionment. It’s either that or fully give in to bitterness.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re always wondering who’s going to wrong you next. You are trained in detecting deception.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re always wondering who’s going to wrong you next. You are trained in detecting deception.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You are trained in tracking creatures. If a creature has wronged you, the tracking task is eased.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You are trained in tracking creatures. If a creature has wronged you, the tracking task is eased.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You have a hard time not letting bitterness stain everything you do. Interaction tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You have a hard time not letting bitterness stain everything you do. Interaction tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a keepsake from whoever wronged you. It could be an object they once possessed, a picture of them, or something else you associate with what makes you so bitter.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a keepsake from whoever wronged you. It could be an object they once possessed, a picture of them, or something else you associate with what makes you so bitter.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: You found the other PCs in a situation they couldn’t survive. Uncharacteristically, you helped them.
trans-unit.target: You found the other PCs in a situation they couldn’t survive. Uncharacteristically, you helped them.

trans-unit.source: You were facing certain death, but the PCs saved you, for no reason other than they saw your need.
trans-unit.target: You were facing certain death, but the PCs saved you, for no reason other than they saw your need.

trans-unit.source: You want to change your ways, and the PCs seem to offer a chance for you to explore that possibility.
trans-unit.target: You want to change your ways, and the PCs seem to offer a chance for you to explore that possibility.

trans-unit.source: You have no idea how you joined the PCs. You’re just going along with it for now until answers present themselves.
trans-unit.target: You have no idea how you joined the PCs. You’re just going along with it for now until answers present themselves.

trans-unit.source: You’re an evolved, intelligent dog with the ability to speak and use tools. Some caniens stand upright and have hands, and others are quadrupeds who can use a combination of their front paws and mouth as adroitly as a handed canien; you decide which kind of canien you are. Most canien clothing and equipment accommodates walking on either two feet or four, so that’s normally not an issue. Either way, you’ve got fur, a tail, and a noble dog visage true to your particular line of descent. And like most caniens, you’re loyal to your pack and friends. But you may find strangers a little suspicious, in which case you aren’t shy about letting them know. However, you’re usually willing to entertain the idea that a newcomer may be a friend you just don’t know yet.
trans-unit.target: You’re an evolved, intelligent dog with the ability to speak and use tools. Some caniens stand upright and have hands, and others are quadrupeds who can use a combination of their front paws and mouth as adroitly as a handed canien; you decide which kind of canien you are. Most canien clothing and equipment accommodates walking on either two feet or four, so that’s normally not an issue. Either way, you’ve got fur, a tail, and a noble dog visage true to your particular line of descent. And like most caniens, you’re loyal to your pack and friends. But you may find strangers a little suspicious, in which case you aren’t shy about letting them know. However, you’re usually willing to entertain the idea that a newcomer may be a friend you just don’t know yet.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You are naturally vigilant. You are trained in perception tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You are naturally vigilant. You are trained in perception tasks.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You are playful. You are trained in tasks involving playing physical games.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You are playful. You are trained in tasks involving playing physical games.

trans-unit.source: Loyal: If an ally within immediate range descends one or more steps on the damage track, you can take an action immediately but in a restricted fashion. You can use this action either to move the willing ally up to an immediate distance or to attempt a healing task on your ally.
trans-unit.target: Loyal: If an ally within immediate range descends one or more steps on the damage track, you can take an action immediately but in a restricted fashion. You can use this action either to move the willing ally up to an immediate distance or to attempt a healing task on your ally.

trans-unit.source: Bite: You are practiced in making unarmed bite attacks (light weapon). Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Bite: You are practiced in making unarmed bite attacks (light weapon). Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Chewer: You are something of an oral fidgeter, like most caniens. After each ten-hour recovery roll, make a difficulty 2 Intellect defense roll. If you fail, you discover you’ve unconsciously been chewing on a piece of your equipment; it’s ruined, at least until it is repaired.
trans-unit.target: Chewer: You are something of an oral fidgeter, like most caniens. After each ten-hour recovery roll, make a difficulty 2 Intellect defense roll. If you fail, you discover you’ve unconsciously been chewing on a piece of your equipment; it’s ruined, at least until it is repaired.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You have a hard time seeing disloyalty in others. Tasks that involve detecting falsehoods are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You have a hard time seeing disloyalty in others. Tasks that involve detecting falsehoods are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: One of the other PCs needed help, and you obliged without a second’s hesitation.
trans-unit.target: One of the other PCs needed help, and you obliged without a second’s hesitation.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs were going somewhere, and you came along even though they didn’t ask you to.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs were going somewhere, and you came along even though they didn’t ask you to.

trans-unit.source: Aggression got the better of you, and now you’re running from the fallout of that experience.
trans-unit.target: Aggression got the better of you, and now you’re running from the fallout of that experience.

trans-unit.source: You feel that one of the other PCs is in danger in some way, and you’d like to help out or keep an eye on them.
trans-unit.target: You feel that one of the other PCs is in danger in some way, and you’d like to help out or keep an eye on them.

trans-unit.source: You’re an evolved, intelligent cat with the ability to speak and use tools. Felis are equally comfortable running on all fours or standing around in a clowder of other felis gossiping over catswort tea. Your fur is your protection from the elements, but you sometimes wear a harness for your equipment and may adopt boots for rough terrain and hats for fashion or function. Your visage is like that of before-times cats, including piercing, reflective eyes. Like other felis, you are crafty and cautious, unless you feel comfortable with others, in which case you can laze away hours in the sun or a warm spot. But if need be, you are quick to act and are not afraid to use your claws to defend yourself.
trans-unit.target: You’re an evolved, intelligent cat with the ability to speak and use tools. Felis are equally comfortable running on all fours or standing around in a clowder of other felis gossiping over catswort tea. Your fur is your protection from the elements, but you sometimes wear a harness for your equipment and may adopt boots for rough terrain and hats for fashion or function. Your visage is like that of before-times cats, including piercing, reflective eyes. Like other felis, you are crafty and cautious, unless you feel comfortable with others, in which case you can laze away hours in the sun or a warm spot. But if need be, you are quick to act and are not afraid to use your claws to defend yourself.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’re innately curious. You are trained in tasks involving knowledge, figuring out problems, or solving puzzles.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’re innately curious. You are trained in tasks involving knowledge, figuring out problems, or solving puzzles.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You are agile. You are trained in tasks involving balancing and movement.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You are agile. You are trained in tasks involving balancing and movement.

trans-unit.source: Darksight: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light and see in darkness as though it were dim light. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Darksight: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light and see in darkness as though it were dim light. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Claws: You are practiced in making unarmed claw attacks (light weapon). Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Claws: You are practiced in making unarmed claw attacks (light weapon). Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Light on Your Paws: You ignore the first 4 points of damage you would otherwise suffer from a fall. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Light on Your Paws: You ignore the first 4 points of damage you would otherwise suffer from a fall. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Jumpy: Like most felis, you are a bit high-strung. Anytime another creature acts with surprise against you, make a difficulty 2 Intellect defense roll. If you fail, the first action you take on your turn is to flee using your full movement away from whoever surprised you.
trans-unit.target: Jumpy: Like most felis, you are a bit high-strung. Anytime another creature acts with surprise against you, make a difficulty 2 Intellect defense roll. If you fail, the first action you take on your turn is to flee using your full movement away from whoever surprised you.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You often come across as aloof. Tasks that involve positive social interaction are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You often come across as aloof. Tasks that involve positive social interaction are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You sometimes get lost in new locations you haven’t visited before. You have an inability in navigation.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You sometimes get lost in new locations you haven’t visited before. You have an inability in navigation.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: Everything was fine until you were attacked by a raiding band of “cat-skinners.” The PCs helped you fight back or flee.
trans-unit.target: Everything was fine until you were attacked by a raiding band of “cat-skinners.” The PCs helped you fight back or flee.

trans-unit.source: You saw the PCs up to something, and your curiosity got the better of you, so you followed them.
trans-unit.target: You saw the PCs up to something, and your curiosity got the better of you, so you followed them.

trans-unit.source: One of the other PCs invited you to join after they saw you scheme, plot, or solve a difficult problem.
trans-unit.target: One of the other PCs invited you to join after they saw you scheme, plot, or solve a difficult problem.

trans-unit.source: You got lost. The PCs found you and invited you to join their group.
trans-unit.target: You got lost. The PCs found you and invited you to join their group.

trans-unit.source: You emerged from the chrysalis with your mind awash in skills instilled while you matured, as well as knowledge handed down from your ancestors. If the stories are true, some of your knowledge comes from even further back, ceded by godlike “humans” who raised flutters into the light of self-knowledge. That was before humans were lost, leaving the world in ruins. Ruins that are now yours to refurbish and rebuild or, as many prefer, to ignore while you instead go your own way. Humans may have created you, but they’re gone, and you can decide what you think you owe them, if anything.
trans-unit.target: You emerged from the chrysalis with your mind awash in skills instilled while you matured, as well as knowledge handed down from your ancestors. If the stories are true, some of your knowledge comes from even further back, ceded by godlike “humans” who raised flutters into the light of self-knowledge. That was before humans were lost, leaving the world in ruins. Ruins that are now yours to refurbish and rebuild or, as many prefer, to ignore while you instead go your own way. Humans may have created you, but they’re gone, and you can decide what you think you owe them, if anything.

trans-unit.source: As a flutter, you are kin to the much smaller natural moths that still flit by night. But you have an internal skeleton and lungs, and are far larger. For all that, you also have wings, a proboscis, and much thinner limbs than the average animal still roaming the world.
trans-unit.target: As a flutter, you are kin to the much smaller natural moths that still flit by night. But you have an internal skeleton and lungs, and are far larger. For all that, you also have wings, a proboscis, and much thinner limbs than the average animal still roaming the world.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You are adept at using your body’s natural patterns of camouflage. You are trained in hiding.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You are adept at using your body’s natural patterns of camouflage. You are trained in hiding.

trans-unit.source: Darksight: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light and can see in darkness as though it were dim light. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Darksight: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light and can see in darkness as though it were dim light. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Fragile: When you fail a Might defense roll to avoid damage, you take 1 extra point of damage.
trans-unit.target: Fragile: When you fail a Might defense roll to avoid damage, you take 1 extra point of damage.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You are confused by bright light. Perception tasks are hindered in bright light.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You are confused by bright light. Perception tasks are hindered in bright light.

trans-unit.source: Erratic Flyer: You can select Hover as if it were on your type’s list of tier 1 abilities. Your ability to move as described in Hover is due to your wings. In addition to the base ability described for Hover, if you succeed on a difficulty 2 Intellect roll, you can keep your position in the air instead of drifting with the wind or allowing momentum to move you. On a failure, you fly erratically as your action, possibly into the ground, a wall, or the midst of enemies you were trying to avoid. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Erratic Flyer: You can select Hover as if it were on your type’s list of tier 1 abilities. Your ability to move as described in Hover is due to your wings. In addition to the base ability described for Hover, if you succeed on a difficulty 2 Intellect roll, you can keep your position in the air instead of drifting with the wind or allowing momentum to move you. On a failure, you fly erratically as your action, possibly into the ground, a wall, or the midst of enemies you were trying to avoid. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: Some piece of knowledge gleaned from your time in the chrysalis made you seek out and join the PCs.
trans-unit.target: Some piece of knowledge gleaned from your time in the chrysalis made you seek out and join the PCs.

trans-unit.source: The ruins are where knowledge of humans exists, and you heard the PCs were headed there.
trans-unit.target: The ruins are where knowledge of humans exists, and you heard the PCs were headed there.

trans-unit.source: You overheard the PCs talking about a grand adventure, and you wanted to be part of it.
trans-unit.target: You overheard the PCs talking about a grand adventure, and you wanted to be part of it.

trans-unit.source: You zigged when you should have zagged and ran headlong into the PCs. They patched you up and you stayed with them.
trans-unit.target: You zigged when you should have zagged and ran headlong into the PCs. They patched you up and you stayed with them.

trans-unit.source: Despite civilization’s fall, you’re optimistic about what the future could bring, confident that it will be bright. In fact, now that all the old institutions and cares of the world are gone, you hope something better can be rebuilt in its place. It’s possible that you’re bubbly and full of cheer. But you might instead be quietly confident, your hope revealed by the way you always try again if at first you fail. Being hopeful doesn’t mean you’re blind to others’ faults, but you can hope they will do better next time, which might lead you to be more forgiving than other survivors. After all, when you screw up, you hope others will allow you the same luxury of learning from your mistakes.
trans-unit.target: Despite civilization’s fall, you’re optimistic about what the future could bring, confident that it will be bright. In fact, now that all the old institutions and cares of the world are gone, you hope something better can be rebuilt in its place. It’s possible that you’re bubbly and full of cheer. But you might instead be quietly confident, your hope revealed by the way you always try again if at first you fail. Being hopeful doesn’t mean you’re blind to others’ faults, but you can hope they will do better next time, which might lead you to be more forgiving than other survivors. After all, when you screw up, you hope others will allow you the same luxury of learning from your mistakes.

trans-unit.source: Skill: Mental malaise doesn’t affect you like it does others. You are trained in Intellect defense tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: Mental malaise doesn’t affect you like it does others. You are trained in Intellect defense tasks.

trans-unit.source: Shrug Off Disappointment: When you fail at a noncombat task and try that task again the very next round, you can apply a free level of Effort toward the success of that task. This benefit effectively alleviates the requirement to apply a level of Effort when retrying failed tasks, at least the first time you retry. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Shrug Off Disappointment: When you fail at a noncombat task and try that task again the very next round, you can apply a free level of Effort toward the success of that task. This benefit effectively alleviates the requirement to apply a level of Effort when retrying failed tasks, at least the first time you retry. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You have a lightness of being, but you really feel it when you’re physically challenged. Might defense tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You have a lightness of being, but you really feel it when you’re physically challenged. Might defense tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You’re spirited but not fast. All movement-related tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You’re spirited but not fast. All movement-related tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The PCs were in a bad spot, and one of the other PCs asked you along to add some perspective.
trans-unit.target: The PCs were in a bad spot, and one of the other PCs asked you along to add some perspective.

trans-unit.source: You had a spot of bad luck, but you jumped back in to try something new, hopeful it would work out.
trans-unit.target: You had a spot of bad luck, but you jumped back in to try something new, hopeful it would work out.

trans-unit.source: To make good on a promise to help, you came with the other PCs.
trans-unit.target: To make good on a promise to help, you came with the other PCs.

trans-unit.source: You answered a cry for help when another PC got in over their head.
trans-unit.target: You answered a cry for help when another PC got in over their head.

trans-unit.source: Savage forces strong enough to destroy a world left you transformed. Either through latent mutations passed down from ancestors that survived the apocalypse, or because something about you reacts when you’re exposed to radiation or some other mutagenic source, you are prone to mutation. You might look relatively similar to others of your species, or you might have one or more obvious physical differences that make it hard to disguise your nature. Not that you necessarily want to hide what you are; you might wish to proudly display what makes you different and, to your mind, better.
trans-unit.target: Savage forces strong enough to destroy a world left you transformed. Either through latent mutations passed down from ancestors that survived the apocalypse, or because something about you reacts when you’re exposed to radiation or some other mutagenic source, you are prone to mutation. You might look relatively similar to others of your species, or you might have one or more obvious physical differences that make it hard to disguise your nature. Not that you necessarily want to hide what you are; you might wish to proudly display what makes you different and, to your mind, better.

trans-unit.source: Significant Mutations: Choose which option from the following list you’d like for your mutations. Whichever you choose, it is rolled for randomly; you don’t select it.
trans-unit.target: Significant Mutations: Choose which option from the following list you’d like for your mutations. Whichever you choose, it is rolled for randomly; you don’t select it.

trans-unit.source: Three beneficial mutations plus one harmful mutation, all rolled randomly
trans-unit.target: Three beneficial mutations plus one harmful mutation, all rolled randomly

trans-unit.source: One powerful mutation and one harmful mutation, both rolled randomly.
trans-unit.target: One powerful mutation and one harmful mutation, both rolled randomly.

trans-unit.source: One beneficial mutation, one distinctive mutation, and one harmful mutation, all rolled randomly.
trans-unit.target: One beneficial mutation, one distinctive mutation, and one harmful mutation, all rolled randomly.

trans-unit.source: Distinctive Mutations: You can choose if you want to have distinctive mutations or not. If you do, choose the number, up to four distinctive mutations, which are rolled for randomly. (If the GM is using the transitory mutations optional rule, you can only choose to have up to three distinctive mutations.)
trans-unit.target: Distinctive Mutations: You can choose if you want to have distinctive mutations or not. If you do, choose the number, up to four distinctive mutations, which are rolled for randomly. (If the GM is using the transitory mutations optional rule, you can only choose to have up to three distinctive mutations.)

trans-unit.source: Cosmetic Mutations: You can choose if you want to have cosmetic mutations or not. If you do, choose whether you want one or two cosmetic mutations, which are rolled for randomly. Once all your mutations have been rolled for, work together with the GM to ensure that what’s been rolled is a character you want to play.
trans-unit.target: Cosmetic Mutations: You can choose if you want to have cosmetic mutations or not. If you do, choose whether you want one or two cosmetic mutations, which are rolled for randomly. Once all your mutations have been rolled for, work together with the GM to ensure that what’s been rolled is a character you want to play.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs found you in some weird “mutant” chrysalis and pulled you out; you were grateful and joined them.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs found you in some weird “mutant” chrysalis and pulled you out; you were grateful and joined them.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs were “hunting mutants” but when they found you, they realized they had been misguided.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs were “hunting mutants” but when they found you, they realized they had been misguided.

trans-unit.source: You wanted to get away from a bad situation, so you went with the PCs.
trans-unit.target: You wanted to get away from a bad situation, so you went with the PCs.

trans-unit.source: The PCs asked you to come along, believing that your particular mutations could be harnessed for the benefit of the mission.
trans-unit.target: The PCs asked you to come along, believing that your particular mutations could be harnessed for the benefit of the mission.

trans-unit.source: Life has dealt you some hard knocks. You lost an eye, an arm, or a leg several years ago, possibly during the apocalypse itself, or perhaps afterward. But you didn’t give up. You adjusted, learning to do everything again, despite what first seemed like a limitation. If you lost a limb, you use a prosthetic; if an eye, you sometimes quip that binocular vision is overrated. Sure, there are times when you struggle with discomfort, pain, and possibly even self-consciousness. However, overcoming all that only makes you stronger and more determined to succeed. Ultimately, your scars, your prosthetic (if any), and your story represent who you are: a survivor who overcomes whatever is thrown your way.
trans-unit.target: Life has dealt you some hard knocks. You lost an eye, an arm, or a leg several years ago, possibly during the apocalypse itself, or perhaps afterward. But you didn’t give up. You adjusted, learning to do everything again, despite what first seemed like a limitation. If you lost a limb, you use a prosthetic; if an eye, you sometimes quip that binocular vision is overrated. Sure, there are times when you struggle with discomfort, pain, and possibly even self-consciousness. However, overcoming all that only makes you stronger and more determined to succeed. Ultimately, your scars, your prosthetic (if any), and your story represent who you are: a survivor who overcomes whatever is thrown your way.

trans-unit.source: Resilient: +2 to your Might Pool or +2 to your Intellect Pool or +1 to all three Pools.
trans-unit.target: Resilient: +2 to your Might Pool or +2 to your Intellect Pool or +1 to all three Pools.

trans-unit.source: Skill: Hard knocks have toughened you; you are trained in either Might defense tasks or Intellect defense tasks (choose one).
trans-unit.target: Skill: Hard knocks have toughened you; you are trained in either Might defense tasks or Intellect defense tasks (choose one).

trans-unit.source: Skill: You had to fake it until you made it; you are trained in one creative skill such as singing, writing, acting, composing, public speaking, painting, sculpture, dancing, or something similar.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You had to fake it until you made it; you are trained in one creative skill such as singing, writing, acting, composing, public speaking, painting, sculpture, dancing, or something similar.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You’ve learned to do everything again and, in truth, better than most people ever could. But your injury is real; it’s why you sometimes joke that you’re “rusted.” If you’ve lost an eye, your perception tasks involving sight are hindered. If you rely on a prosthetic leg, tasks requiring movement are hindered. If you rely on a prosthetic arm, tasks involving using both hands are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You’ve learned to do everything again and, in truth, better than most people ever could. But your injury is real; it’s why you sometimes joke that you’re “rusted.” If you’ve lost an eye, your perception tasks involving sight are hindered. If you rely on a prosthetic leg, tasks requiring movement are hindered. If you rely on a prosthetic arm, tasks involving using both hands are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a prosthetic for one arm or one leg, or you have an eyepatch (and prosthetic eye) for a missing eye.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a prosthetic for one arm or one leg, or you have an eyepatch (and prosthetic eye) for a missing eye.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure:
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure:

trans-unit.source: You bragged that there’s nothing someone else could do that you couldn’t do twice as well, which is how you got involved in your current situation.
trans-unit.target: You bragged that there’s nothing someone else could do that you couldn’t do twice as well, which is how you got involved in your current situation.

trans-unit.source: You’re afraid of what might happen if the other PCs fail.
trans-unit.target: You’re afraid of what might happen if the other PCs fail.

trans-unit.source: You were tailing one of the other PCs for reasons of your own, which brought you into the action.
trans-unit.target: You were tailing one of the other PCs for reasons of your own, which brought you into the action.

trans-unit.source: You stepped in to defend one of the PCs when that character was threatened. While talking to them afterward, you heard about the group’s task.
trans-unit.target: You stepped in to defend one of the PCs when that character was threatened. While talking to them afterward, you heard about the group’s task.

trans-unit.source: You’re brash and bright, and you exult in situations, people, and objects that seem to you as if they have a similar sheen. Literally shiny objects qualify, as well as objects that are not rusted or degraded by time’s passage or the effects of the apocalypse. You also tend to fall into the orbit of people who are strong, unbeaten, and possessed of an inner brightness. You believe that they, like you, reflect the light of some greater spiritual purpose in the world. When you believe you are acting in that glow, you are emboldened and may take risks others fear. You don’t seek death, but you’re confident that death in the pursuit of something shiny is the definition of a life well-lived.
trans-unit.target: You’re brash and bright, and you exult in situations, people, and objects that seem to you as if they have a similar sheen. Literally shiny objects qualify, as well as objects that are not rusted or degraded by time’s passage or the effects of the apocalypse. You also tend to fall into the orbit of people who are strong, unbeaten, and possessed of an inner brightness. You believe that they, like you, reflect the light of some greater spiritual purpose in the world. When you believe you are acting in that glow, you are emboldened and may take risks others fear. You don’t seek death, but you’re confident that death in the pursuit of something shiny is the definition of a life well-lived.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You’ve had practice driving a before-times vehicle. Choose a motorcycle, car or truck, or long-haul truck; you’re trained in driving that kind of vehicle.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You’ve had practice driving a before-times vehicle. Choose a motorcycle, car or truck, or long-haul truck; you’re trained in driving that kind of vehicle.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You know how to get out of the way. You are trained in Speed defense tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You know how to get out of the way. You are trained in Speed defense tasks.

trans-unit.source: Shiny Maneuver: You know how to push yourself harder, at the risk of a more dramatic failure. When you attempt a shiny maneuver, you ease a task, attack roll, or defense roll, but in doing so you increase the intrusion range by two for that roll, to a 1–3 on a d20. If you fail and decide to retry the task (requiring that you spend a level of Effort, as normal), it has the same increased intrusion range. Once you attempt a shiny maneuver, you can’t attempt another until you make a recovery roll. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Shiny Maneuver: You know how to push yourself harder, at the risk of a more dramatic failure. When you attempt a shiny maneuver, you ease a task, attack roll, or defense roll, but in doing so you increase the intrusion range by two for that roll, to a 1–3 on a d20. If you fail and decide to retry the task (requiring that you spend a level of Effort, as normal), it has the same increased intrusion range. Once you attempt a shiny maneuver, you can’t attempt another until you make a recovery roll. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You may be lithe and shiny, but you’re not sneaky. Tasks related to sneaking and staying quiet are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You may be lithe and shiny, but you’re not sneaky. Tasks related to sneaking and staying quiet are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You are irrepressible, but that makes it hard to dissemble. Deception and disguise tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You are irrepressible, but that makes it hard to dissemble. Deception and disguise tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a treasured object that is literally shiny in bright light, such as a polished stainless-steel sphere, a silver coin, a pocket watch from the before-times, or something else small and easily carried.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a treasured object that is literally shiny in bright light, such as a polished stainless-steel sphere, a silver coin, a pocket watch from the before-times, or something else small and easily carried.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: It seemed like there were equal odds that the other PCs wouldn’t succeed, which sounded good to you.
trans-unit.target: It seemed like there were equal odds that the other PCs wouldn’t succeed, which sounded good to you.

trans-unit.source: The first word that popped into your head upon seeing the PCs was “shiny.”
trans-unit.target: The first word that popped into your head upon seeing the PCs was “shiny.”

trans-unit.source: You think the tasks ahead will present you with unique and fulfilling challenges.
trans-unit.target: You think the tasks ahead will present you with unique and fulfilling challenges.

trans-unit.source: Someone you trust and respect above all others suggested you join the PCs to help them complete their task.
trans-unit.target: Someone you trust and respect above all others suggested you join the PCs to help them complete their task.

trans-unit.source: The Scavenges focus can be used as written in the Cypher System Rulebook, but whenever the abilities point to the scavenging rules and tables from the rulebook (including Ruin Lore, Junkmonger, Know Where to Look, and other abilities), use the optional rule for scavenging, repairing, and building in this book instead.
trans-unit.target: The Scavenges focus can be used as written in the Cypher System Rulebook, but whenever the abilities point to the scavenging rules and tables from the rulebook (including Ruin Lore, Junkmonger, Know Where to Look, and other abilities), use the optional rule for scavenging, repairing, and building in this book instead.

trans-unit.source: In a post-apocalyptic setting, some GMs may want to offer species affected by the disaster.
trans-unit.target: In a post-apocalyptic setting, some GMs may want to offer species affected by the disaster.

trans-unit.source: You have lived your life deep underground in artificial bunkers, hidden from the world’s destruction and the brutal scavengers that live above. As a morlock, you have a keen mind for the technology salvaged from the before-time. In fact, every morlock comes of age by fitting a piece of morlock technology to its body to provide enhancement and extend its life. This means that you are part flesh and part machine. Your skin is as pale as milk, except where it’s been replaced with strips of metal and glowing circuits.
trans-unit.target: You have lived your life deep underground in artificial bunkers, hidden from the world’s destruction and the brutal scavengers that live above. As a morlock, you have a keen mind for the technology salvaged from the before-time. In fact, every morlock comes of age by fitting a piece of morlock technology to its body to provide enhancement and extend its life. This means that you are part flesh and part machine. Your skin is as pale as milk, except where it’s been replaced with strips of metal and glowing circuits.

trans-unit.source: Enhanced Intelligence: +2 to your Intellect Pool.
trans-unit.target: Enhanced Intelligence: +2 to your Intellect Pool.

trans-unit.source: Cyborg Body: +2 to your Might Pool and your Speed Pool.
trans-unit.target: Cyborg Body: +2 to your Might Pool and your Speed Pool.

trans-unit.source: Repair and Maintenance: As an entity of living flesh and humming machinery, you must first succeed on a difficulty 2 repair task before making a recovery roll. On a failure, the recovery roll is not used; however, the normal rules for retrying apply, and you must use Effort on a new roll if you wish to try again. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to heal additional points to your Pools (each level of Effort healing an additional 2 points to your Pools if you succeed).
trans-unit.target: Repair and Maintenance: As an entity of living flesh and humming machinery, you must first succeed on a difficulty 2 repair task before making a recovery roll. On a failure, the recovery roll is not used; however, the normal rules for retrying apply, and you must use Effort on a new roll if you wish to try again. In addition to the normal options for using Effort, you can choose to use Effort to heal additional points to your Pools (each level of Effort healing an additional 2 points to your Pools if you succeed).

trans-unit.source: Morlock Prejudice: While among non-morlocks, all positive interaction tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Morlock Prejudice: While among non-morlocks, all positive interaction tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The PCs found you in a collapsed subterranean tunnel.
trans-unit.target: The PCs found you in a collapsed subterranean tunnel.

trans-unit.source: The other PCs encountered you exploring underground, and you convinced them to allow you to accompany them.
trans-unit.target: The other PCs encountered you exploring underground, and you convinced them to allow you to accompany them.

trans-unit.source: You were exiled from the morlock communities and needed help on the surface.
trans-unit.target: You were exiled from the morlock communities and needed help on the surface.

trans-unit.source: The only way to save the morlock community you hail from is to venture to the surface and find a mechanical part needed to repair a failing ancient system.
trans-unit.target: The only way to save the morlock community you hail from is to venture to the surface and find a mechanical part needed to repair a failing ancient system.

trans-unit.source: You are born of a species of evolved insects once called “cockroach,” but that is far in the past. Radiation and forced evolution have radically increased your size, shape, and ability to think. Your exoskeleton mimics the shape of a human being, though not perfectly. When you move about human society, shadows and cloaks are your ally if you wish to pass unnoticed. When those of your kind are discovered, it usually goes poorly for someone. You, however, have a wandering spirit and seek to explore the fallen world and find a new way forward.
trans-unit.target: You are born of a species of evolved insects once called “cockroach,” but that is far in the past. Radiation and forced evolution have radically increased your size, shape, and ability to think. Your exoskeleton mimics the shape of a human being, though not perfectly. When you move about human society, shadows and cloaks are your ally if you wish to pass unnoticed. When those of your kind are discovered, it usually goes poorly for someone. You, however, have a wandering spirit and seek to explore the fallen world and find a new way forward.

trans-unit.source: Scuttler: Your Speed Edge increases by 1.
trans-unit.target: Scuttler: Your Speed Edge increases by 1.

trans-unit.source: Sense by Scent: You can sense your environment even in total darkness.
trans-unit.target: Sense by Scent: You can sense your environment even in total darkness.

trans-unit.source: Cling: You can move an immediate distance each round on walls or clinging to the ceiling.
trans-unit.target: Cling: You can move an immediate distance each round on walls or clinging to the ceiling.

trans-unit.source: Glide: You can extend small wings from your carapace that grant an asset in jumping tasks and allow you to fall up to a short distance without taking damage.
trans-unit.target: Glide: You can extend small wings from your carapace that grant an asset in jumping tasks and allow you to fall up to a short distance without taking damage.

trans-unit.source: Skill: You are trained in disguise tasks.
trans-unit.target: Skill: You are trained in disguise tasks.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You are susceptible to disease and poison. Defense rolls against disease or poison are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You are susceptible to disease and poison. Defense rolls against disease or poison are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Inability: You mimic a human, but you are not as fierce. Tasks involving combat— including attack and defense rolls—are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Inability: You mimic a human, but you are not as fierce. Tasks involving combat— including attack and defense rolls—are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Insect Prejudice: While among non-roaches, all positive interaction tasks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Insect Prejudice: While among non-roaches, all positive interaction tasks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.
trans-unit.target: Initial Link to the Starting Adventure: From the following list of options, choose how you became involved in the first adventure.

trans-unit.source: The PCs didn’t realize what you were when they asked for your help.
trans-unit.target: The PCs didn’t realize what you were when they asked for your help.

trans-unit.source: You’ve managed to hide your roach ancestry so well that everyone thinks you are like them.
trans-unit.target: You’ve managed to hide your roach ancestry so well that everyone thinks you are like them.

trans-unit.source: You are the last of your kind.
trans-unit.target: You are the last of your kind.

trans-unit.source: You have a secret agenda, and the PCs were gullible enough to let you come along.
trans-unit.target: You have a secret agenda, and the PCs were gullible enough to let you come along.

trans-unit.source: This section presents new post-apocalyptic foci that can be used as-is in most games set after civilization falls. As these were created specifically for the post-apocalyptic genre, each has an expanded description with more story details than the foci in the Cypher System Rulebook (which have short, broad descriptions suitable for other genres).
trans-unit.target: This section presents new post-apocalyptic foci that can be used as-is in most games set after civilization falls. As these were created specifically for the post-apocalyptic genre, each has an expanded description with more story details than the foci in the Cypher System Rulebook (which have short, broad descriptions suitable for other genres).

trans-unit.source: You were raised in an underground bunker by Milly, an AI instance installed in your brain before you developed cognition of your own. Unlike AI zombies, your personality and motivations haven’t been replaced; your sense of self grew alongside the AI, as collaborators rather than foes. This granted you superior intellect and an uncanny knack for computers. Now you’ve emerged into the larger world, where survivors are predisposed to distrust you, and you may need to keep your background a secret to be accepted. Whether you hate AI or remain loyal to Milly, you face the best odds if you can fit in with another group of survivors. After all, there’s a lot you don’t know about how things work on the surface and the things people have done to stay alive in the past twenty years.
trans-unit.target: You were raised in an underground bunker by Milly, an AI instance installed in your brain before you developed cognition of your own. Unlike AI zombies, your personality and motivations haven’t been replaced; your sense of self grew alongside the AI, as collaborators rather than foes. This granted you superior intellect and an uncanny knack for computers. Now you’ve emerged into the larger world, where survivors are predisposed to distrust you, and you may need to keep your background a secret to be accepted. Whether you hate AI or remain loyal to Milly, you face the best odds if you can fit in with another group of survivors. After all, there’s a lot you don’t know about how things work on the surface and the things people have done to stay alive in the past twenty years.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You fear that character is jealous of your abilities, and that it might lead to problems.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You fear that character is jealous of your abilities, and that it might lead to problems.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You’re not sure how or from where, but that character has access to rare machine parts and can get them for you at half price.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You’re not sure how or from where, but that character has access to rare machine parts and can get them for you at half price.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. Seeing you use your focus abilities triggers unpleasant memories for that character. That memory is up to the other PC, although they may not be able to consciously recall it.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. Seeing you use your focus abilities triggers unpleasant memories for that character. That memory is up to the other PC, although they may not be able to consciously recall it.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They are sensitive to your focus abilities, and occasionally they become dazed for a few rounds, hindering their actions.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They are sensitive to your focus abilities, and occasionally they become dazed for a few rounds, hindering their actions.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have scars on your scalp in the shape of circuitry (like Lichtenberg figures). You probably keep these hidden, as they identify you as one of Milly’s children to anyone familiar with the mark.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have scars on your scalp in the shape of circuitry (like Lichtenberg figures). You probably keep these hidden, as they identify you as one of Milly’s children to anyone familiar with the mark.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Intellect Pool. Major Effect Suggestion: An ally or indicated target can take an additional action.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Intellect Pool. Major Effect Suggestion: An ally or indicated target can take an additional action.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Assisted Sight or Machine Telepathy as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Assisted Sight or Machine Telepathy as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Assisted Sight (3 Intellect points): You can activate a visual overlay that helps you analyze threats and boons in your environment. When you trigger this ability, you gain an asset on one attack or defense roll of any type, due to your knowledge about the situation. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Assisted Sight (3 Intellect points): You can activate a visual overlay that helps you analyze threats and boons in your environment. When you trigger this ability, you gain an asset on one attack or defense roll of any type, due to your knowledge about the situation. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Master Machine or See the Future as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Master Machine or See the Future as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Merges Mind With Machine is a focus designed for use with the Radio Quiet setting.
trans-unit.target: Merges Mind With Machine is a focus designed for use with the Radio Quiet setting.

trans-unit.source: You prepared for ultimate disaster, unlike most of the sheeple. Which means you stashed away food, water, and other survival gear when things were still okay. You trained yourself for harsh conditions, for basic machine and electronic repair, and maybe even in a musical instrument to pass the time in the bunker when no other entertainments could be had. You’d excel in a small group of other survivors, but you’re ready to go it alone if that’s what it takes. Above all, you’re prepared to make it through whatever the future holds, no matter how daunting the odds. Because you prepped wisely.
trans-unit.target: You prepared for ultimate disaster, unlike most of the sheeple. Which means you stashed away food, water, and other survival gear when things were still okay. You trained yourself for harsh conditions, for basic machine and electronic repair, and maybe even in a musical instrument to pass the time in the bunker when no other entertainments could be had. You’d excel in a small group of other survivors, but you’re ready to go it alone if that’s what it takes. Above all, you’re prepared to make it through whatever the future holds, no matter how daunting the odds. Because you prepped wisely.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You found them in your prepped hideout, eating and drinking their fill. You befriended them rather than seeking revenge for using your resources.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You found them in your prepped hideout, eating and drinking their fill. You befriended them rather than seeking revenge for using your resources.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You used to play card games with them before the apocalypse, and you still owe them money, though what that means now is difficult to say.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You used to play card games with them before the apocalypse, and you still owe them money, though what that means now is difficult to say.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character doesn’t seem to want any of your stored food or water.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character doesn’t seem to want any of your stored food or water.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. When you were hurt, they carried you to your prepped hideout at great risk to themselves.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. When you were hurt, they carried you to your prepped hideout at great risk to themselves.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: A firearm of your choice (with ten bullets or shells), a handloading tool set, and a small musical instrument (such as a harmonica).
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: A firearm of your choice (with ten bullets or shells), a handloading tool set, and a small musical instrument (such as a harmonica).

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your foe slips in some decaying garbage or spill from the before‑times, and their actions in the next round are hindered as they regain their balance. Major Effect Suggestion: You find or spy an item from the Useful Stuff table.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: Your foe slips in some decaying garbage or spill from the before‑times, and their actions in the next round are hindered as they regain their balance. Major Effect Suggestion: You find or spy an item from the Useful Stuff table.

trans-unit.source: Practiced in Light Armor: You can wear light armor for long periods of time without tiring and can compensate for slowed reactions from wearing light armor. You reduce the Speed cost for wearing light armor by 1. You start the game with a type of light armor available in the area, such as a leather jacket. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Practiced in Light Armor: You can wear light armor for long periods of time without tiring and can compensate for slowed reactions from wearing light armor. You reduce the Speed cost for wearing light armor by 1. You start the game with a type of light armor available in the area, such as a leather jacket. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Prepared Caches: You have a prepped secret hideout with shelter and basic supplies capable of seeing you through a year or more, or up to six people through about three months. In addition, you have knowledge of three different secret supply caches you put together and hid before everything fell apart, chosen from the following. The caches are located no closer than about 5 miles (8 km) from each other.
trans-unit.target: Prepared Caches: You have a prepped secret hideout with shelter and basic supplies capable of seeing you through a year or more, or up to six people through about three months. In addition, you have knowledge of three different secret supply caches you put together and hid before everything fell apart, chosen from the following. The caches are located no closer than about 5 miles (8 km) from each other.

trans-unit.source: Food cache (enough food for six people for twelve weeks)
trans-unit.target: Food cache (enough food for six people for twelve weeks)

trans-unit.source: Water cache (enough clean water for six people for twelve weeks)
trans-unit.target: Water cache (enough clean water for six people for twelve weeks)

trans-unit.source: Ammunition cache (400 shells or bullets for four different weapons)
trans-unit.target: Ammunition cache (400 shells or bullets for four different weapons)

trans-unit.source: Firearm cache (six firearms; a mix of light, medium, and heavy weapons, each usually found with about ten bullets or shells) Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Firearm cache (six firearms; a mix of light, medium, and heavy weapons, each usually found with about ten bullets or shells) Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Trained for Toughing It: Choose one noncombat skill that would be helpful for surviving after the apocalypse, such as hunting, tracking, carpentry, or stealth. You are trained in that skill. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Trained for Toughing It: Choose one noncombat skill that would be helpful for surviving after the apocalypse, such as hunting, tracking, carpentry, or stealth. You are trained in that skill. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Fruitfully Pass the Time or Stashed Vehicle as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Fruitfully Pass the Time or Stashed Vehicle as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Fruitfully Pass the Time (4 Intellect points): You are trained in one performance skill, such as singing; playing a fiddle, harmonica, or other instrument; or something else that others would enjoy watching or hearing you do. When you perform with the skill gained through this ability for one minute and you succeed on a difficulty 3 performance roll, you and all allies within short range who can hear and see you immediately gain a one‑action recovery roll. You can’t use this on someone again until you use a one‑hour or ten‑hour recovery roll. Action to initiate, one minute to complete.
trans-unit.target: Fruitfully Pass the Time (4 Intellect points): You are trained in one performance skill, such as singing; playing a fiddle, harmonica, or other instrument; or something else that others would enjoy watching or hearing you do. When you perform with the skill gained through this ability for one minute and you succeed on a difficulty 3 performance roll, you and all allies within short range who can hear and see you immediately gain a one‑action recovery roll. You can’t use this on someone again until you use a one‑hour or ten‑hour recovery roll. Action to initiate, one minute to complete.

trans-unit.source: Stashed Vehicle: You track down where you or a fellow prepper stashed a vehicle, pristinely stored to remain in working order with minimal repairs required. The vehicle has a viable power source (such as hundreds of gallons of gasoline treated to resist decomposition, or a rechargeable battery with options for solar or wind recharging). The vehicle could be an all‑terrain vehicle (ATV), a truck, or something else; work with your GM to figure out the particulars. Enabler
trans-unit.target: Stashed Vehicle: You track down where you or a fellow prepper stashed a vehicle, pristinely stored to remain in working order with minimal repairs required. The vehicle has a viable power source (such as hundreds of gallons of gasoline treated to resist decomposition, or a rechargeable battery with options for solar or wind recharging). The vehicle could be an all‑terrain vehicle (ATV), a truck, or something else; work with your GM to figure out the particulars. Enabler

trans-unit.source: Know Where to Look: Whenever the GM obtains a result for you on the Useful Stuff table, you get two results instead of one. If the GM is using some other method to generate rewards for finding valuables, you gain double the result you would otherwise obtain. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Know Where to Look: Whenever the GM obtains a result for you on the Useful Stuff table, you get two results instead of one. If the GM is using some other method to generate rewards for finding valuables, you gain double the result you would otherwise obtain. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Discipline of Watchfulness or Escape the Ruins as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Discipline of Watchfulness or Escape the Ruins as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Escape the Ruins (6 Intellect points): While in any area containing ruins from before the apocalypse, you find or create a significant shortcut, secret entrance, or emergency escape route where it looked like none existed. Doing so requires that you succeed on an Intellect action whose difficulty is set by the GM based on the situation. You and the GM should work out the details. Action.
trans-unit.target: Escape the Ruins (6 Intellect points): While in any area containing ruins from before the apocalypse, you find or create a significant shortcut, secret entrance, or emergency escape route where it looked like none existed. Doing so requires that you succeed on an Intellect action whose difficulty is set by the GM based on the situation. You and the GM should work out the details. Action.

trans-unit.source: When civilization fell, you did what you had to do to stay alive. Did you kill innocent people? Probably, insofar as anyone who survived the end can really be considered “innocent.” You figured they’d have done the same to you. But whether they deserved it or not, you and the other raiders you ran with survived, and your targets did not. Then something life‑changing happened to you, altering your perspective; it’s up to you to decide what. In any case, you’ve turned over a new leaf. You don’t indiscriminately kill anymore, though surviving is still a goal. But you’ve joined with others who you want to protect as much as or even more than your own life. You’re done with raiding. But is raiding (and those who might recognize you as a raider) done with you?
trans-unit.target: When civilization fell, you did what you had to do to stay alive. Did you kill innocent people? Probably, insofar as anyone who survived the end can really be considered “innocent.” You figured they’d have done the same to you. But whether they deserved it or not, you and the other raiders you ran with survived, and your targets did not. Then something life‑changing happened to you, altering your perspective; it’s up to you to decide what. In any case, you’ve turned over a new leaf. You don’t indiscriminately kill anymore, though surviving is still a goal. But you’ve joined with others who you want to protect as much as or even more than your own life. You’re done with raiding. But is raiding (and those who might recognize you as a raider) done with you?

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. That character knows that you were a raider, even though it is a secret you’ve kept from the other PCs so far.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. That character knows that you were a raider, even though it is a secret you’ve kept from the other PCs so far.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They were also a raider, however briefly, along with you (if they agree to this connection).
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They were also a raider, however briefly, along with you (if they agree to this connection).

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You feel very protective of this character and don’t want to see them harmed.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You feel very protective of this character and don’t want to see them harmed.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You know that you’re responsible for the death of someone that character knew while you were raiding; they don’t know it, but the guilt has been waking you up in the middle of the night.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You know that you’re responsible for the death of someone that character knew while you were raiding; they don’t know it, but the guilt has been waking you up in the middle of the night.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: You have a tattoo from your raiding days that you probably keep hidden, as it would identify you as a raider to those familiar with the mark.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: You have a tattoo from your raiding days that you probably keep hidden, as it would identify you as a raider to those familiar with the mark.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Might Pool. Major Effect Suggestion: You or an ally get an immediate extra attack.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You restore 2 points to your Might Pool. Major Effect Suggestion: You or an ally get an immediate extra attack.

trans-unit.source: Careful Tracker: You are trained in stealth and tracking tasks. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Careful Tracker: You are trained in stealth and tracking tasks. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Raider Follower or Grand Deception as your tier 3 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Raider Follower or Grand Deception as your tier 3 ability.

trans-unit.source: Raider Follower: You gain a level 3 follower (initiative, stealth, and defense as level 4). The follower does as you say and, generally speaking, isn’t someone who makes the other PCs in your group feel uncomfortable because of their presence. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Raider Follower: You gain a level 3 follower (initiative, stealth, and defense as level 4). The follower does as you say and, generally speaking, isn’t someone who makes the other PCs in your group feel uncomfortable because of their presence. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Deep Consideration or Twisting the Knife as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Deep Consideration or Twisting the Knife as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: You are a student of the before‑times. Maybe that’s because you grew up in the ruins of an old library and read everything as your hobby, you found a friendly AI archivist who taught you about how things once were, you’re long‑lived and were alive before the apocalypse, or you have a deep recollection of the world before the end for some other reason. This knowledge gives you an appreciation of the before‑times as well as a point of view that many other survivors lack that benefits you in and around ruins. You can find things others wouldn’t know to look for, plucking fruits of the past that would otherwise go unharvested.
trans-unit.target: You are a student of the before‑times. Maybe that’s because you grew up in the ruins of an old library and read everything as your hobby, you found a friendly AI archivist who taught you about how things once were, you’re long‑lived and were alive before the apocalypse, or you have a deep recollection of the world before the end for some other reason. This knowledge gives you an appreciation of the before‑times as well as a point of view that many other survivors lack that benefits you in and around ruins. You can find things others wouldn’t know to look for, plucking fruits of the past that would otherwise go unharvested.

trans-unit.source: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Connection: Choose one of the following, or choose one of the Focus Connections in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. They remind you of someone you knew or learned about from the past, because of either the way they look or the way they act, and that is what first drew you to them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. They remind you of someone you knew or learned about from the past, because of either the way they look or the way they act, and that is what first drew you to them.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You saved their life because you found them trapped in a before‑times ruin and you knew how best to free them.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You saved their life because you found them trapped in a before‑times ruin and you knew how best to free them.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. You were lost out past the ruins in the wilderness, but they happened across you and saved your life.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. You were lost out past the ruins in the wilderness, but they happened across you and saved your life.

trans-unit.source: Pick one other PC. This character comes from the same place you do, and you knew each other as children.
trans-unit.target: Pick one other PC. This character comes from the same place you do, and you knew each other as children.

trans-unit.source: Additional Equipment: One book on a technical topic such as plumbing, carpentry, electronics, or physics; it provides you an asset on a related task if you spend ten minutes perusing the book ahead of time.
trans-unit.target: Additional Equipment: One book on a technical topic such as plumbing, carpentry, electronics, or physics; it provides you an asset on a related task if you spend ten minutes perusing the book ahead of time.

trans-unit.source: Minor Effect Suggestion: You remember something about the area that proves advantageous later, such as realizing there’s probably a fresh location to scavenge close by that has a good chance of not having been picked over by other survivors.
trans-unit.target: Minor Effect Suggestion: You remember something about the area that proves advantageous later, such as realizing there’s probably a fresh location to scavenge close by that has a good chance of not having been picked over by other survivors.

trans-unit.source: Major Effect Suggestion: A foe forgets about you unless you draw attention to yourself.
trans-unit.target: Major Effect Suggestion: A foe forgets about you unless you draw attention to yourself.

trans-unit.source: Ruin Lore: You are trained in scavenging, which means you’re more likely to find useful things (and junk that can potentially be turned into useful things) in the ruins of what came before. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Ruin Lore: You are trained in scavenging, which means you’re more likely to find useful things (and junk that can potentially be turned into useful things) in the ruins of what came before. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Fixer: You’ve learned enough of the past that you are trained in tasks to repair and build before‑times equipment, or equipment made with before‑times parts. In addition, repairing and building tasks take you about 20% less time to complete. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Fixer: You’ve learned enough of the past that you are trained in tasks to repair and build before‑times equipment, or equipment made with before‑times parts. In addition, repairing and building tasks take you about 20% less time to complete. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Know the Way: You are familiar with before‑times buildings and other structures, which extends to ruins of the same. You are trained in tasks related to getting around inside those buildings quickly, finding alternate routes, finding places to hide, and other tasks associated with gaining a benefit by being able to picture a likely floor plan of any given building. Enabler.
trans-unit.target: Know the Way: You are familiar with before‑times buildings and other structures, which extends to ruins of the same. You are trained in tasks related to getting around inside those buildings quickly, finding alternate routes, finding places to hide, and other tasks associated with gaining a benefit by being able to picture a likely floor plan of any given building. Enabler.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Disable Mechanisms or Resource Seeker as your tier 3 ability. Disable Mechanisms
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Disable Mechanisms or Resource Seeker as your tier 3 ability. Disable Mechanisms

trans-unit.source: Resource Seeker (3+ Intellect points): When you are looking for a specific inexpensive item you’d like to scavenge from nearby ruins, such as a candle, an aspirin, or a can of preserved chili, you can focus your attention on it so that you are more likely to find it. For the next ten minutes, if what you are seeking is within long range, you find it if you succeed on a difficulty 2 Intellect roll. Each time you use this ability again in the same area, the difficulty is hindered by one additional step. For each level of Effort you apply, you can attempt to find an object of one higher expense category, but the base difficulty of the Intellect roll also increases by 1 per higher expense category. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Resource Seeker (3+ Intellect points): When you are looking for a specific inexpensive item you’d like to scavenge from nearby ruins, such as a candle, an aspirin, or a can of preserved chili, you can focus your attention on it so that you are more likely to find it. For the next ten minutes, if what you are seeking is within long range, you find it if you succeed on a difficulty 2 Intellect roll. Each time you use this ability again in the same area, the difficulty is hindered by one additional step. For each level of Effort you apply, you can attempt to find an object of one higher expense category, but the base difficulty of the Intellect roll also increases by 1 per higher expense category. Action to initiate.

trans-unit.source: Ability Choice: Choose either Skill With Attacks, Skill With Defense, or Use the Network as your tier 6 ability.
trans-unit.target: Ability Choice: Choose either Skill With Attacks, Skill With Defense, or Use the Network as your tier 6 ability.

trans-unit.source: Use the Network (5 Intellect points): With a few minutes of looking around and preparing, you can access remnants of the before‑times internet and satellite network (or an active network on which AIs who are not immediately dangerous reside). The GM may decide there is no such connection in the area, but if there is, you can ask one basic question about anything happening within 10 miles (16 km) and receive a simple answer. For example, you could ask about the location of a specific creature or individual, and if they are within the range of this ability, you’ll learn about it from a still‑functioning camera feed, satellite feed, or AI interaction. Action to initiate.
trans-unit.target: Use the Network (5 Intellect points): With a few minutes of looking around and preparing, you can access remnants of the before‑times internet and satellite network (or an active network on which AIs who are not immediately dangerous reside).
