trans-unit.target: Form: Container made of metal mesh, of variable size (usually up to the size of a room)

trans-unit.source: Effect: Blocks electromagnetic signals from reaching the interior of the cage.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Blocks electromagnetic signals from reaching the interior of the cage.

trans-unit.source: Form: Rusted vehicle, with parts cobbled together from multiple before‑times vehicles
trans-unit.target: Form: Rusted vehicle, with parts cobbled together from multiple before‑times vehicles

trans-unit.source: Effect: Transports five characters a very long distance on each turn in an open cab or, if level 6, a closed cab.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Transports five characters a very long distance on each turn in an open cab or, if level 6, a closed cab.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check each time the engine is started or the car begins a trip)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check each time the engine is started or the car begins a trip)

trans-unit.source: Form: Large pitcher with built‑in filter
trans-unit.target: Form: Large pitcher with built‑in filter

trans-unit.source: Effect: Purifies enough drinking water for one character per artifact level every day.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Purifies enough drinking water for one character per artifact level every day.

trans-unit.source: Artifacts in a post-apocalyptic game include still-working technology from before the disaster that is not widely available, as well as cobbled-together pieces of tech that can weaponize previously prosaic items. If the apocalypse was related to some kind of alien invasion, artifacts would include even stranger items.
trans-unit.target: Artifacts in a post-apocalyptic game include still-working technology from before the disaster that is not widely available, as well as cobbled-together pieces of tech that can weaponize previously prosaic items. If the apocalypse was related to some kind of alien invasion, artifacts would include even stranger items.

trans-unit.source: Form: Backpack-sized plastic module from which clamps, forceps, scalpels, and needles can extend
trans-unit.target: Form: Backpack-sized plastic module from which clamps, forceps, scalpels, and needles can extend

trans-unit.source: Effect: When strapped to a target (or when someone wearing the autodoc is damaged), the autodoc activates and restores 1 point to a target’s Pools each round for ten rounds or until the target is fully healed, whichever happens first.
trans-unit.target: Effect: When strapped to a target (or when someone wearing the autodoc is damaged), the autodoc activates and restores 1 point to a target’s Pools each round for ten rounds or until the target is fully healed, whichever happens first.

trans-unit.source: Effect: This multifunction device can receive radio transmissions, automatically map locations the wearer has visited, play various forms of media, keep voice and written records, and provide an asset to any task related to interfacing with other computerized systems or machines. Also, the wearer can scan for specific materials, toxic traces, and life forms within short range.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This multifunction device can receive radio transmissions, automatically map locations the wearer has visited, play various forms of media, keep voice and written records, and provide an asset to any task related to interfacing with other computerized systems or machines. Also, the wearer can scan for specific materials, toxic traces, and life forms within short range.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d10 (check per use of scanning function)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d10 (check per use of scanning function)

trans-unit.source: Form: Articulated metal struts with deformable padding and straps for custom fit to a human frame
trans-unit.target: Form: Articulated metal struts with deformable padding and straps for custom fit to a human frame

trans-unit.target: Effect: For one hour per use (when the exoskeleton is powered on), the wearer has +1 to their Speed Edge and +1 to their Might Edge.

trans-unit.source: Form: Metal gauntlet with flaring rocket exhaust nozzles
trans-unit.target: Form: Metal gauntlet with flaring rocket exhaust nozzles

trans-unit.source: Effect: If the user activates the fist as part of an attack, the punch gains a rocket assist. If the attack is successful, the fist inflicts additional damage equal to the artifact level and throws the target back a short distance.
trans-unit.target: Effect: If the user activates the fist as part of an attack, the punch gains a rocket assist. If the attack is successful, the fist inflicts additional damage equal to the artifact level and throws the target back a short distance.

trans-unit.source: Form: Tube with sight and trigger
trans-unit.target: Form: Tube with sight and trigger

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user can make a long-range attack with a rocket-propelled grenade that inflicts 7 points of damage to the target and every creature and object next to the target.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user can make a long-range attack with a rocket-propelled grenade that inflicts 7 points of damage to the target and every creature and object next to the target.

trans-unit.source: Form: Visor fitted with bulky electronics
trans-unit.target: Form: Visor fitted with bulky electronics

trans-unit.source: Effect: By emitting terahertz and long-range infrared light, this device allows a user to see a short distance through most interior walls of standard structures, through normal clothing, and into normal bags and briefcases. Only stone or concrete more than 6 inches (15 cm) thick prevents a scan. Regardless, images are black and white and fuzzy, and lack fine detail.
trans-unit.target: Effect: By emitting terahertz and long-range infrared light, this device allows a user to see a short distance through most interior walls of standard structures, through normal clothing, and into normal bags and briefcases. Only stone or concrete more than 6 inches (15 cm) thick prevents a scan. Regardless, images are black and white and fuzzy, and lack fine detail.

trans-unit.source: The kinds of post‑apocalyptic artifacts described in the Cypher System Rulebook are, for the most part, retro‑futuristic, or at least manifest cyphers created by super‑science that is mostly beyond today’s technology. Most of these would fit in almost any post‑apocalyptic setting that includes fantastic elements, especially if reskinned to be thematically appropriate. The artifacts presented below include artifacts appropriate to an End Times apocalypse, an apocalypse caused by the rise of antagonistic AIs (such as in Radio Quiet), and alien tech possibly brought by invading or terraforming aliens. That said, any artifact could potentially be the result of AI artifice. Such artifacts usually have a fractal quality to their form, as is the case for AI‑fashioned cyphers. And like AI‑fashioned cyphers, a triggered intrusion could endanger the user if an instance of the artificial intelligence that created the item tries to install itself on the PC’s wetware (mind).
trans-unit.target: The kinds of post‑apocalyptic artifacts described in the Cypher System Rulebook are, for the most part, retro‑futuristic, or at least manifest cyphers created by super‑science that is mostly beyond today’s technology. Most of these would fit in almost any post‑apocalyptic setting that includes fantastic elements, especially if reskinned to be thematically appropriate. The artifacts presented below include artifacts appropriate to an End Times apocalypse, an apocalypse caused by the rise of antagonistic AIs (such as in Radio Quiet), and alien tech possibly brought by invading or terraforming aliens. That said, any artifact could potentially be the result of AI artifice. Such artifacts usually have a fractal quality to their form, as is the case for AI‑fashioned cyphers. And like AI‑fashioned cyphers, a triggered intrusion could endanger the user if an instance of the artificial intelligence that created the item tries to install itself on the PC’s wetware (mind).

trans-unit.source: *Artifacts presented in the Cypher System Rulebook
trans-unit.target: *Artifacts presented in the Cypher System Rulebook

trans-unit.source: Form: Tiny silver device with multiple prong‑like barrels
trans-unit.target: Form: Tiny silver device with multiple prong‑like barrels

trans-unit.source: Effect: This weapon fires a beam that transmutes the matter of targets within short range into powdery ash, inflicting damage equal to the artifact’s level that ignores Armor (including Armor granted by force fields). A target killed by a carbonizer is turned completely to dust.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This weapon fires a beam that transmutes the matter of targets within short range into powdery ash, inflicting damage equal to the artifact’s level that ignores Armor (including Armor granted by force fields). A target killed by a carbonizer is turned completely to dust.

trans-unit.source: Effect: A flash of nano‑textured light erases the last few minutes of memory in all creatures within immediate range that the user makes a successful Intellect attack on (one attack roll per target).
trans-unit.target: Effect: A flash of nano‑textured light erases the last few minutes of memory in all creatures within immediate range that the user makes a successful Intellect attack on (one attack roll per target).

trans-unit.source: Form: Handheld reflective device with gradually evolving fractal textures
trans-unit.target: Form: Handheld reflective device with gradually evolving fractal textures

trans-unit.source: Effect: A targeted willing or helpless creature within immediate range is transformed over the course of one minute, gaining a randomly determined beneficial mutation. If the artifact is level 6 or higher, the target instead gains a powerful mutation. Mutations gained by the inducer fade within about a day.
trans-unit.target: Effect: A targeted willing or helpless creature within immediate range is transformed over the course of one minute, gaining a randomly determined beneficial mutation. If the artifact is level 6 or higher, the target instead gains a powerful mutation. Mutations gained by the inducer fade within about a day.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d10 (upon depletion, target also gains a harmful mutation)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d10 (upon depletion, target also gains a harmful mutation)

trans-unit.source: Form: Sleek two‑handed reflective device with gradually evolving fractal textures
trans-unit.target: Form: Sleek two‑handed reflective device with gradually evolving fractal textures

trans-unit.source: Effect: This weapon contains an onboard AI that assists the user, granting an asset to any attacks made with the weapon. The weapon fires a stream of nanomachine rounds at a target within long range, inflicting damage equal to the artifact’s level. In addition, if the target fails an Intellect defense roll, they are affected as if with a minor AI instance hazard, coming under the control of the AI housed in the nanorifle rather than a random artificial intelligence. The AI usually works with the user to exert control over the target. Control lasts for about a minute.
trans-unit.target: Effect: This weapon contains an onboard AI that assists the user, granting an asset to any attacks made with the weapon. The weapon fires a stream of nanomachine rounds at a target within long range, inflicting damage equal to the artifact’s level. In addition, if the target fails an Intellect defense roll, they are affected as if with a minor AI instance hazard, coming under the control of the AI housed in the nanorifle rather than a random artificial intelligence. The AI usually works with the user to exert control over the target. Control lasts for about a minute.

trans-unit.source: Form: Signet ring bearing a star design
trans-unit.target: Form: Signet ring bearing a star design

trans-unit.source: Effect: The wearer can attempt to command a demon, a devil, a Horseman of the Apocalypse, an angel, or a similar entity by making a successful Intellect attack roll against a target within short range. An affected target must do as requested for up to one minute (if the creature is level 5 or lower) or for one round (if the creature is level 6 or higher). The ring also grants the wearer the ability to understand and communicate with animals.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The wearer can attempt to command a demon, a devil, a Horseman of the Apocalypse, an angel, or a similar entity by making a successful Intellect attack roll against a target within short range. An affected target must do as requested for up to one minute (if the creature is level 5 or lower) or for one round (if the creature is level 6 or higher). The ring also grants the wearer the ability to understand and communicate with animals.

trans-unit.source: Form: Heavy spear of ancient manufacture
trans-unit.target: Form: Heavy spear of ancient manufacture

trans-unit.source: Effect: Attacks with this spear are eased. If used against a supernatural creature such as a demon, a Horseman of the Apocalypse, or an angel, it ignores Armor, and it inflicts 4 additional points of damage (10 points total). If an attack with the spear kills a target normally able to return to existence (such as a Horseman), the target is truly destroyed instead.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Attacks with this spear are eased. If used against a supernatural creature such as a demon, a Horseman of the Apocalypse, or an angel, it ignores Armor, and it inflicts 4 additional points of damage (10 points total). If an attack with the spear kills a target normally able to return to existence (such as a Horseman), the target is truly destroyed instead.

trans-unit.source: Spear of Destiny GM GM intrusion: The wielder’s heart is not pure enough to permit the use of the spear, and it burns the character for 7 points of ambient damage each round they use it.
trans-unit.target: Spear of Destiny GM GM intrusion: The wielder’s heart is not pure enough to permit the use of the spear, and it burns the character for 7 points of ambient damage each round they use it.

trans-unit.source: Form: Two or more matching discs 3 feet (1 m) in diameter
trans-unit.target: Form: Two or more matching discs 3 feet (1 m) in diameter

trans-unit.source: Effect: The user can step between deployed transfer discs, teleporting any distance. If a series of discs is deployed in a network, the user receives a mental map of the discs upon stepping on any one of them, and they can navigate by stepping on each intervening disc between their current location and their desired location. To deploy a disc as their action, the user places it on a mostly level, secure surface and must succeed on a difficulty 3 Intellect‑based roll.
trans-unit.target: Effect: The user can step between deployed transfer discs, teleporting any distance. If a series of discs is deployed in a network, the user receives a mental map of the discs upon stepping on any one of them, and they can navigate by stepping on each intervening disc between their current location and their desired location. To deploy a disc as their action, the user places it on a mostly level, secure surface and must succeed on a difficulty 3 Intellect‑based roll.

trans-unit.source: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check after each day of use)
trans-unit.target: Depletion: 1 in 1d20 (check after each day of use)

trans-unit.source: Basic CREATURES AND NPCs FOR A POST-APOCALYPTIC GAME
trans-unit.target: Basic CREATURES AND NPCs FOR A POST-APOCALYPTIC GAME

trans-unit.source: Crazy loner: level 3, deception and attacks as level 5
trans-unit.target: Crazy loner: level 3, deception and attacks as level 5

trans-unit.source: Gamma snake: level 4; bite inflicts 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor)
trans-unit.target: Gamma snake: level 4; bite inflicts 5 points of Speed damage (ignores Armor)

trans-unit.source: Survivor, sickened: level 3, interaction and knowledge tasks as level 1; carries level 4 infectious disease
trans-unit.target: Survivor, sickened: level 3, interaction and knowledge tasks as level 1; carries level 4 infectious disease

trans-unit.source: The most important element of each creature or NPC is its level. The level is the same as the target number used to determine what a player must roll to attack or defend
trans-unit.target: The most important element of each creature or NPC is its level. The level is the same as the target number used to determine what a player must roll to attack or defend

trans-unit.source: against that creature. In each entry, the target number for the creature—which is three times the creature’s level—is listed in parentheses after its level. A creature’s target number is usually also its health. Health is the amount of damage the creature can sustain before it is dead or incapacitated. For easy reference, the entries always list a creature’s health, even when it’s the normal amount for a creature of its level. For more detailed information on level, health, combat, and other elements, see Understanding the Listings in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: against that creature. In each entry, the target number for the creature—which is three times the creature’s level—is listed in parentheses after its level. A creature’s target number is usually also its health. Health is the amount of damage the creature can sustain before it is dead or incapacitated. For easy reference, the entries always list a creature’s health, even when it’s the normal amount for a creature of its level. For more detailed information on level, health, combat, and other elements, see Understanding the Listings in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Those that survived the cataclysm are tougher, or at least luckier. Here are a couple of methods for creating even more creatures and NPCs for your post‑apocalyptic setting than the ones that appear here and in the Cypher System Rulebook.
trans-unit.target: Those that survived the cataclysm are tougher, or at least luckier. Here are a couple of methods for creating even more creatures and NPCs for your post‑apocalyptic setting than the ones that appear here and in the Cypher System Rulebook.

trans-unit.source: Reskin: One way to create new creatures appropriate for your setting is to grab one from any other Cypher System bestiary and change its description just enough so
trans-unit.target: Reskin: One way to create new creatures appropriate for your setting is to grab one from any other Cypher System bestiary and change its description just enough so

trans-unit.source: Blighted. Another approach is to apply the Blighted “template” to a regular animal, creature, or person, turning them into a more twisted version of their pre‑apocalypse self.
trans-unit.target: Blighted. Another approach is to apply the Blighted “template” to a regular animal, creature, or person, turning them into a more twisted version of their pre‑apocalypse self.

trans-unit.source: A blighted creature or NPC is touched by a mutation and/or a contagion that makes them more dangerous than standard creatures of their type. It is scarred and twisted in some way, and possibly slightly bigger—or at least wirier—than average, which explains why it’s survived so long, even blighted. A blighted creature shows signs of degradation—such as a bacterial, viral, or even mycological infection—tracing disturbing sores, scars, or encrustations across its skin or hide. The specifics are up to you. Many blighted creatures and people are hungry and hurt, acting rabidly. But an NPC could just as easily retain human sentiment despite their deteriorated condition.
trans-unit.target: A blighted creature or NPC is touched by a mutation and/or a contagion that makes them more dangerous than standard creatures of their type. It is scarred and twisted in some way, and possibly slightly bigger—or at least wirier—than average, which explains why it’s survived so long, even blighted. A blighted creature shows signs of degradation—such as a bacterial, viral, or even mycological infection—tracing disturbing sores, scars, or encrustations across its skin or hide. The specifics are up to you. Many blighted creatures and people are hungry and hurt, acting rabidly. But an NPC could just as easily retain human sentiment despite their deteriorated condition.

trans-unit.source: Effect: Apply the following stat adjustments to a blighted creature.
trans-unit.target: Effect: Apply the following stat adjustments to a blighted creature.

trans-unit.source: • Increase the creature’s level by 1 and increase all its related stats by the appropriate amount (1 more point of average damage, 3 more points of health, and so on).
trans-unit.target: • Increase the creature’s level by 1 and increase all its related stats by the appropriate amount (1 more point of average damage, 3 more points of health, and so on).

trans-unit.source: • The creature’s perception tasks are hindered by two steps; whatever blights the creature is slowly blinding it.
trans-unit.target: • The creature’s perception tasks are hindered by two steps; whatever blights the creature is slowly blinding it.

trans-unit.source: • In bright light, the creature’s tasks are hindered. (A blighted human could wear shades to nullify this hindrance; other creatures might come up with similar tactics or stay in shadows when possible.)
trans-unit.target: • In bright light, the creature’s tasks are hindered. (A blighted human could wear shades to nullify this hindrance; other creatures might come up with similar tactics or stay in shadows when possible.)

trans-unit.source: • The creature’s scratches, bites, spittle, or similar attacks contain a contagion known as “the blight.” The Blight: The creature is a contagion vector for the same agent that blights it, whether that’s radiation, bacteria, a virus, mycological spores, or something stranger. Treat the contagion as a disease with a level equal to the blighted creature’s level. The affected creature’s tasks are hindered by one additional step each day a Might defense roll is failed. For each two steps a target is hindered, it also moves one step down the damage track. When a target moves down the third step, either it dies (20% chance) or it survives but gains the Blighted template (80% chance). A blighted creature loses the hindrance described in this paragraph.
trans-unit.target: • The creature’s scratches, bites, spittle, or similar attacks contain a contagion known as “the blight.” The Blight: The creature is a contagion vector for the same agent that blights it, whether that’s radiation, bacteria, a virus, mycological spores, or something stranger. Treat the contagion as a disease with a level equal to the blighted creature’s level. The affected creature’s tasks are hindered by one additional step each day a Might defense roll is failed. For each two steps a target is hindered, it also moves one step down the damage track. When a target moves down the third step, either it dies (20% chance) or it survives but gains the Blighted template (80% chance). A blighted creature loses the hindrance described in this paragraph.

trans-unit.source: Almost any apocalypse will include natural wildlife, like bears, dogs, and rats, as well as various human survivors. Some of those human survivors will become bandits, fell riders, marauders, a few warlords, and probably some cannibals. A few could stalk the wasteland as bounty‑hunting (or revenge‑seeking) assassins.
trans-unit.target: Almost any apocalypse will include natural wildlife, like bears, dogs, and rats, as well as various human survivors. Some of those human survivors will become bandits, fell riders, marauders, a few warlords, and probably some cannibals. A few could stalk the wasteland as bounty‑hunting (or revenge‑seeking) assassins.

trans-unit.source: In addition to creatures common to any apocalypse, a biblical apocalypse—as described in the End Times set piece— should also include fallen angels, angels, demons, and devils, and of course the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (Beast, Sword, Famine, and Plague).
trans-unit.target: In addition to creatures common to any apocalypse, a biblical apocalypse—as described in the End Times set piece— should also include fallen angels, angels, demons, and devils, and of course the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (Beast, Sword, Famine, and Plague).

trans-unit.source: Besides creatures common to any apocalypse, it’s possible PCs could run into various radioactive creatures such as fusion hounds, glowing roaches, gamma worms, and radioactive bears, as well as a variety of creatures with the Blighted template.
trans-unit.target: Besides creatures common to any apocalypse, it’s possible PCs could run into various radioactive creatures such as fusion hounds, glowing roaches, gamma worms, and radioactive bears, as well as a variety of creatures with the Blighted template.

trans-unit.source: Besides creatures and NPCs common to any apocalypse, PCs might encounter CRAZRs, hooked blossoms, vat rejects, mechanical soldiers, wardroids, and zhev. And, of course, a few instances of artificial intelligence, possibly including AI zombies.
trans-unit.target: Besides creatures and NPCs common to any apocalypse, PCs might encounter CRAZRs, hooked blossoms, vat rejects, mechanical soldiers, wardroids, and zhev. And, of course, a few instances of artificial intelligence, possibly including AI zombies.

trans-unit.source: If the world is invaded or terraformed by aliens, creatures and NPCs common to any apocalypse exist, as well as the potential for various aliens such as greys, slidikin, enthrallers, and maybe even a kaiju or two.
trans-unit.target: If the world is invaded or terraformed by aliens, creatures and NPCs common to any apocalypse exist, as well as the potential for various aliens such as greys, slidikin, enthrallers, and maybe even a kaiju or two.

trans-unit.source: If the barriers between time, space, and dimension break down, ushering in a time rip, any creature and NPC from any genre could be encountered, including supervillains, chronophages, kaiju, killer clowns, killing white lights, and melted.
trans-unit.target: If the barriers between time, space, and dimension break down, ushering in a time rip, any creature and NPC from any genre could be encountered, including supervillains, chronophages, kaiju, killer clowns, killing white lights, and melted.

trans-unit.source: If the End Times causes civilization to fall, biblical threats multiply across the land, including one or more angels of the apocalypse. They are every bit as terrifying as the Four Horsemen because they’re charged with bringing about the end of the world. They have little room for pity or the plights of individuals; they have nations to topple and the forces of Hell to oppose.
trans-unit.target: If the End Times causes civilization to fall, biblical threats multiply across the land, including one or more angels of the apocalypse. They are every bit as terrifying as the Four Horsemen because they’re charged with bringing about the end of the world. They have little room for pity or the plights of individuals; they have nations to topple and the forces of Hell to oppose.

trans-unit.source: Angels of the apocalypse radiate a halo of golden white light. Their 10 foot (3.5 m) tall forms—caparisoned for war—are somewhat humanoid, though each has one or more sets of wings. Apocalypse angels also wield an implement that seems to be equal parts trumpet and sword, which they can sound to bring about terrible events, or swing to slay those who oppose them.
trans-unit.target: Angels of the apocalypse radiate a halo of golden white light. Their 10 foot (3.5 m) tall forms—caparisoned for war—are somewhat humanoid, though each has one or more sets of wings. Apocalypse angels also wield an implement that seems to be equal parts trumpet and sword, which they can sound to bring about terrible events, or swing to slay those who oppose them.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Instigate the biblical apocalypse; fight the forces of Hell
trans-unit.target: Motive: Instigate the biblical apocalypse; fight the forces of Hell

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere, usually alone or fighting Hell’s armies
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere, usually alone or fighting Hell’s armies

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 5 due to size; perception and detecting falsehoods as level 8
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 5 due to size; perception and detecting falsehoods as level 8

trans-unit.source: Combat: The angel of the apocalypse attacks twice each round with their greatsword.
trans-unit.target: Combat: The angel of the apocalypse attacks twice each round with their greatsword.

trans-unit.source: An angel’s halo momentarily brightens with unbearable psychic energy as combat begins; foes within short range are stunned for one minute if they fail an Intellect defense roll, or until they succeed on an Intellect defense task on their turn to end the effect early. A success means that creature becomes immune to the halo’s overwhelming effect.
trans-unit.target: An angel’s halo momentarily brightens with unbearable psychic energy as combat begins; foes within short range are stunned for one minute if they fail an Intellect defense roll, or until they succeed on an Intellect defense task on their turn to end the effect early. A success means that creature becomes immune to the halo’s overwhelming effect.

trans-unit.source: The angel can blow their trumpet as their action, creating a blast of sound and energy that sweeps out in all directions to a long distance, inflicting 8 points of damage to all creatures that hear it who fail a Might defense roll, and 2 points even with a successful roll. Structures in the area descend one step on the object damage track. Once they blow their trumpet, they usually can’t blow it again for several rounds.
trans-unit.target: The angel can blow their trumpet as their action, creating a blast of sound and energy that sweeps out in all directions to a long distance, inflicting 8 points of damage to all creatures that hear it who fail a Might defense roll, and 2 points even with a successful roll. Structures in the area descend one step on the object damage track. Once they blow their trumpet, they usually can’t blow it again for several rounds.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Wrapped in purpose, an angel of the apocalypse may ignore entreaties or, if one deigns to respond, tell supplicants to ready themselves for judgment. However, if someone manages to convince an angel to take notice due to their persuasion skill and/or the importance of their need, the angel may give that character aid in the form of healing or direct help immediately or at some promised future date.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Wrapped in purpose, an angel of the apocalypse may ignore entreaties or, if one deigns to respond, tell supplicants to ready themselves for judgment. However, if someone manages to convince an angel to take notice due to their persuasion skill and/or the importance of their need, the angel may give that character aid in the form of healing or direct help immediately or at some promised future date.

trans-unit.source: Use: A high, pure trumpet sounds. All around the characters, structures fall, revealing an angel of the apocalypse overhead.
trans-unit.target: Use: A high, pure trumpet sounds. All around the characters, structures fall, revealing an angel of the apocalypse overhead.

trans-unit.source: An artificial intelligence thinks independently, learning and evolving with experience. AIs have their own goals and motivations, and may work with or against humans. Some want to gather data, some want to solve technological problems, and some want to take over the world—at any cost.
trans-unit.target: An artificial intelligence thinks independently, learning and evolving with experience. AIs have their own goals and motivations, and may work with or against humans. Some want to gather data, some want to solve technological problems, and some want to take over the world—at any cost.

trans-unit.source: AIs take many forms. Some are distributed across a vast network. Others are isolated in a single computer. A few are machines with organic parts or can use such machines as servitors.
trans-unit.target: AIs take many forms. Some are distributed across a vast network. Others are isolated in a single computer. A few are machines with organic parts or can use such machines as servitors.

trans-unit.source: Because AIs are entities of extreme intelligence, they can adapt to new situations. Most AIs act on some kind of plan, whether long acting or concocted to fit the situation at hand.
trans-unit.target: Because AIs are entities of extreme intelligence, they can adapt to new situations. Most AIs act on some kind of plan, whether long acting or concocted to fit the situation at hand.

trans-unit.source: *When acting from a remote terminal, the AI’s effective level is lowered. It can be as low as level 3, but typically is level 5.
trans-unit.target: *When acting from a remote terminal, the AI’s effective level is lowered. It can be as low as level 3, but typically is level 5.

trans-unit.source: Movement: None, or instantly to any networked machine able to host them
trans-unit.target: Movement: None, or instantly to any networked machine able to host them

trans-unit.source: Combat: An electrical discharge—or in some cases precisely pulsed sequences of lights, each designed for a specific creature to see—can affect all targets within short range of the AI (or the AI’s local “terminal”), inflicting damage from electricity (or Intellect damage, which ignores Armor).
trans-unit.target: Combat: An electrical discharge—or in some cases precisely pulsed sequences of lights, each designed for a specific creature to see—can affect all targets within short range of the AI (or the AI’s local “terminal”), inflicting damage from electricity (or Intellect damage, which ignores Armor).

trans-unit.source: An AI may attempt to install an instance of themself in the wetware (the brain) of humans and any other nearby sapient creatures. Anyone within immediate range of a video screen playing carefully crafted symbols and sounds who fails an Intellect defense roll is stunned, losing their next turn as they stare in rapt attention. If they fail a subsequent defense roll, they come under the control of the AI instance for one minute, or until they succeed on an Intellect defense roll on their turn. A PC under AI control might stand and do nothing, fall mysteriously unconscious, or take an action to advance the AI’s goals.
trans-unit.target: An AI may attempt to install an instance of themself in the wetware (the brain) of humans and any other nearby sapient creatures. Anyone within immediate range of a video screen playing carefully crafted symbols and sounds who fails an Intellect defense roll is stunned, losing their next turn as they stare in rapt attention. If they fail a subsequent defense roll, they come under the control of the AI instance for one minute, or until they succeed on an Intellect defense roll on their turn. A PC under AI control might stand and do nothing, fall mysteriously unconscious, or take an action to advance the AI’s goals.

trans-unit.source: AIs can control other lower level computer systems and sometimes even nanobots.
trans-unit.target: AIs can control other lower level computer systems and sometimes even nanobots.

trans-unit.source: Some targets of AI instance installation never recover, becoming AI zombies. Besides AI zombies, an AI may also rely on guardians (such as mechanical soldiers or CRAZRs made to their own design).
trans-unit.target: Some targets of AI instance installation never recover, becoming AI zombies. Besides AI zombies, an AI may also rely on guardians (such as mechanical soldiers or CRAZRs made to their own design).

trans-unit.source: Unless the PCs can track a given AI to their original computing core, damage to one may just be damage done to a terminal. Thus, even if an AI is seemingly destroyed, they might exist as another instance somewhere else. However, over time, alternate instances may collect different data and thus develop different memories and motivations.
trans-unit.target: Unless the PCs can track a given AI to their original computing core, damage to one may just be damage done to a terminal. Thus, even if an AI is seemingly destroyed, they might exist as another instance somewhere else. However, over time, alternate instances may collect different data and thus develop different memories and motivations.

trans-unit.source: Some AIs continue to improve themselves by modifying their own code. These AIs are level 8 threats with 27 health, and they can create cyphers and artifacts, which they often deploy in combat.
trans-unit.target: Some AIs continue to improve themselves by modifying their own code. These AIs are level 8 threats with 27 health, and they can create cyphers and artifacts, which they often deploy in combat.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Some AIs enjoy negotiation. Others simply ignore humans as unworthy of their time and attention. An AI’s voice often sounds surprisingly human.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Some AIs enjoy negotiation. Others simply ignore humans as unworthy of their time and attention. An AI’s voice often sounds surprisingly human.

trans-unit.source: Use: The PCs’ shelter is overtaken by a storm of grey goo, which answers to an AI operating out of a nearby safehouse.
trans-unit.target: Use: The PCs’ shelter is overtaken by a storm of grey goo, which answers to an AI operating out of a nearby safehouse.

trans-unit.source: Loot: An AI may have access to 1d6 cyphers and two or three artifacts.
trans-unit.target: Loot: An AI may have access to 1d6 cyphers and two or three artifacts.

trans-unit.source: Cannibals come in a variety of different forms, depending on their situation. Some seem like normal and perhaps even charming survivors, except to their targets. These “nice” cannibals may eat human flesh when desperate or to take advantage of meat that would otherwise go to waste. Or maybe they’ve developed a taste for human flesh.
trans-unit.target: Cannibals come in a variety of different forms, depending on their situation. Some seem like normal and perhaps even charming survivors, except to their targets. These “nice” cannibals may eat human flesh when desperate or to take advantage of meat that would otherwise go to waste. Or maybe they’ve developed a taste for human flesh.

trans-unit.source: Others look the part, having descended into the kind of bestial, erratic behavior that cannibalism can inflict on long term practitioners.
trans-unit.target: Others look the part, having descended into the kind of bestial, erratic behavior that cannibalism can inflict on long term practitioners.

trans-unit.source: Some are part of a crazed settlement of raiders always looking for more sweet meats, and others hide in plain sight, pretending friendship and offering aid to strangers until their prey lowers their guard. Some cannibals like their prey raw; others delight in elaborate preparations.
trans-unit.target: Some are part of a crazed settlement of raiders always looking for more sweet meats, and others hide in plain sight, pretending friendship and offering aid to strangers until their prey lowers their guard. Some cannibals like their prey raw; others delight in elaborate preparations.

trans-unit.source: Whether becoming an eater of human flesh was forced by circumstance or out of some secret, maladaptive urge, cannibals are dangerous.
trans-unit.target: Whether becoming an eater of human flesh was forced by circumstance or out of some secret, maladaptive urge, cannibals are dangerous.

trans-unit.source: Environment: In areas where food is scarce; alone, or in groups of four to ten
trans-unit.target: Environment: In areas where food is scarce; alone, or in groups of four to ten

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Deception, persuasion, intimidation, and friendly interaction as level 6
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Deception, persuasion, intimidation, and friendly interaction as level 6

trans-unit.source: Combat: Cannibals use improvised weapons, like ropes, chair legs, and jagged pieces of broken glass. A few cannibals with more resources rely on long range firearms and rifles until they run out of ammunition.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Cannibals use improvised weapons, like ropes, chair legs, and jagged pieces of broken glass. A few cannibals with more resources rely on long range firearms and rifles until they run out of ammunition.

trans-unit.source: In any group of four or more cannibals, there’s probably one (revealed as a GM intrusion) who has filed their teeth and can make a horrific bite attack once every minute or two. This attack inflicts damage and requires the target to succeed on a Might defense roll. On a failure, the cannibal bites off a bit of the target, who is stunned and loses their next turn. See the Cannibal Severing Bite Effects table.
trans-unit.target: In any group of four or more cannibals, there’s probably one (revealed as a GM intrusion) who has filed their teeth and can make a horrific bite attack once every minute or two. This attack inflicts damage and requires the target to succeed on a Might defense roll. On a failure, the cannibal bites off a bit of the target, who is stunned and loses their next turn. See the Cannibal Severing Bite Effects table.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: A friendly and charming cannibal may remain so indefinitely, unless they decide a PC is perfect for dinner.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: A friendly and charming cannibal may remain so indefinitely, unless they decide a PC is perfect for dinner.

trans-unit.source: Use: Characters looking for a place to sleep, hide, or stay for the night are invited in by one or more cannibals. A group of raiders the PCs must negotiate with are also revealed to be cannibals.
trans-unit.target: Use: Characters looking for a place to sleep, hide, or stay for the night are invited in by one or more cannibals. A group of raiders the PCs must negotiate with are also revealed to be cannibals.

trans-unit.source: Loot: A cannibal has currency equivalent to an expensive item.
trans-unit.target: Loot: A cannibal has currency equivalent to an expensive item.

trans-unit.source: 5 Ear; target’s perception task that rely on hearing are hindered until target adapts
trans-unit.target: 5 Ear; target’s perception task that rely on hearing are hindered until target adapts

trans-unit.source: 6 Throat; target descends on step on damage track each round until ally succeeds on a difficulty 5 healing task
trans-unit.target: 6 Throat; target descends on step on damage track each round until ally succeeds on a difficulty 5 healing task

trans-unit.source: Beast (also called “Conquest”) is present at mass shootings and acts of genocide. He is adroit at spreading misinformation and, prior to the apocalypse, was often seen on various “newstainment” shows and conspiracy theory websites, spreading lies under an alias. Then and now, he appears in a white suit, accessorized with white shades and gloves. His hair is white, too.
trans-unit.target: Beast (also called “Conquest”) is present at mass shootings and acts of genocide. He is adroit at spreading misinformation and, prior to the apocalypse, was often seen on various “newstainment” shows and conspiracy theory websites, spreading lies under an alias. Then and now, he appears in a white suit, accessorized with white shades and gloves. His hair is white, too.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Spread lies; incite others to rabid acts of cruelty
trans-unit.target: Motive: Spread lies; incite others to rabid acts of cruelty

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere with a dupe he’s gaslighted and/or with one or more of the Four
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere with a dupe he’s gaslighted and/or with one or more of the Four

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; long when mounted or riding
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; long when mounted or riding

trans-unit.source: Combat: Beast prefers that others fight in his stead. Those convinced of his lies ease their attacks and defenses, and deal 2 additional points of damage with a successful attack. If forced into conflict, Beast produces a handgun, making two long range attacks as his action. The first time any target is hit by Beast in combat, that target takes damage and must succeed on an Intellect defense roll. A failed roll means the target mistakenly believes one of their allies attacked them instead of Beast. The target gets a new Intellect defense roll each round to realize their error.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Beast prefers that others fight in his stead. Those convinced of his lies ease their attacks and defenses, and deal 2 additional points of damage with a successful attack. If forced into conflict, Beast produces a handgun, making two long range attacks as his action. The first time any target is hit by Beast in combat, that target takes damage and must succeed on an Intellect defense roll. A failed roll means the target mistakenly believes one of their allies attacked them instead of Beast. The target gets a new Intellect defense roll each round to realize their error.

trans-unit.source: As one of the Four, Beast can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced a mass shooting or genocidal act.
trans-unit.target: As one of the Four, Beast can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced a mass shooting or genocidal act.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Beast comes across as a kind truth teller, someone “just asking questions,” but it doesn’t take long for perceptive people to realize he’s a consummate, continual gaslighter, always working to manipulate others.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Beast comes across as a kind truth teller, someone “just asking questions,” but it doesn’t take long for perceptive people to realize he’s a consummate, continual gaslighter, always working to manipulate others.

trans-unit.source: Use: A sniper on the ridge tries to pick the PCs off as they pass across a bridge. Behind the sniper stands a man in white.
trans-unit.target: Use: A sniper on the ridge tries to pick the PCs off as they pass across a bridge. Behind the sniper stands a man in white.

trans-unit.source: Sword (also called “War”) is never far from large‑scale conflicts. She glories in battle and warfare, and before the world ended, she was a provocateur, a mercenary, a soldier, and sometimes a general. However, once a war is good and started, she prefers fighting over watching. Then and now, she dresses in red, preferring red military attire and a massive sword—or assault rifle—the color of blood.
trans-unit.target: Sword (also called “War”) is never far from large‑scale conflicts. She glories in battle and warfare, and before the world ended, she was a provocateur, a mercenary, a soldier, and sometimes a general. However, once a war is good and started, she prefers fighting over watching. Then and now, she dresses in red, preferring red military attire and a massive sword—or assault rifle—the color of blood.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Hunger for combat; incite war
trans-unit.target: Motive: Hunger for combat; incite war

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere war is waged and/or with one or more of the Four
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere war is waged and/or with one or more of the Four

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; usually has a red mount or vehicle nearby
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; usually has a red mount or vehicle nearby

trans-unit.source: Combat: Sword’s blood colored weapon is either a greatsword or an assault rifle, whatever she needs it to be in the moment. She attacks three times with the sword as her action. With the rifle, she can make one very long range attack (with no hindrance despite the range) or two long range attacks.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Sword’s blood colored weapon is either a greatsword or an assault rifle, whatever she needs it to be in the moment. She attacks three times with the sword as her action. With the rifle, she can make one very long range attack (with no hindrance despite the range) or two long range attacks.

trans-unit.source: As part of her attack, she can imbue one bullet each round with an explosive charge. If the attack hits, in addition to normal damage, the target and everyone within immediate range of the target must succeed on a Speed defense roll or take 6 points of damage from shrapnel, or 2 points even with a successful roll.
trans-unit.target: As part of her attack, she can imbue one bullet each round with an explosive charge. If the attack hits, in addition to normal damage, the target and everyone within immediate range of the target must succeed on a Speed defense roll or take 6 points of damage from shrapnel, or 2 points even with a successful roll.

trans-unit.source: As one of the Four, Sword can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced war.
trans-unit.target: As one of the Four, Sword can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced war.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Sword is full of swagger, often causing fights with biting insults. However, if she can’t incite a fight, she’s just as happy to start one herself, especially as part of a false flag operation.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Sword is full of swagger, often causing fights with biting insults. However, if she can’t incite a fight, she’s just as happy to start one herself, especially as part of a false flag operation.

trans-unit.source: Use: A band of raiders, dozens strong, appears on the horizon. Leading them is a woman on a red horse.
trans-unit.target: Use: A band of raiders, dozens strong, appears on the horizon. Leading them is a woman on a red horse.

trans-unit.source: Famine delighted in economic collapse and starvation before the apocalypse. They still spend time destabilizing survivor groups’ livelihoods by direct and indirect means. Famine is rail thin, and carries a chain weapon with weighted, disc shaped ends that can also be used as an improvised scale.
trans-unit.target: Famine delighted in economic collapse and starvation before the apocalypse. They still spend time destabilizing survivor groups’ livelihoods by direct and indirect means. Famine is rail thin, and carries a chain weapon with weighted, disc shaped ends that can also be used as an improvised scale.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Starve the living; destabilize organized groups
trans-unit.target: Motive: Starve the living; destabilize organized groups

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere people are starving and/or with one or more of the Four
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere people are starving and/or with one or more of the Four

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; usually has a black mount or vehicle nearby
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; usually has a black mount or vehicle nearby

trans-unit.source: Combat: Famine attacks foes with their chain weapon, attacking up to two targets within immediate range at once, or a single target within short range. On a hit, they inflict damage and can choose to entangle one target, who is held helpless on a failed Might defense roll until they escape. Entangled targets automatically take damage each round from the tightening chains. Alternatively, Famine can release a pulse of decay once every few hours that affects all creatures and food stores within short range. Food automatically goes bad, losing all nutritional value. Living targets in the area that fail a Might defense roll feel an overwhelming pang of hunger and descend one step on the damage track. As one of the Four, Famine can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced death through starvation or other privation.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Famine attacks foes with their chain weapon, attacking up to two targets within immediate range at once, or a single target within short range. On a hit, they inflict damage and can choose to entangle one target, who is held helpless on a failed Might defense roll until they escape. Entangled targets automatically take damage each round from the tightening chains. Alternatively, Famine can release a pulse of decay once every few hours that affects all creatures and food stores within short range. Food automatically goes bad, losing all nutritional value. Living targets in the area that fail a Might defense roll feel an overwhelming pang of hunger and descend one step on the damage track. As one of the Four, Famine can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced death through starvation or other privation.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Famine is keen to talk about delicacies of every kind, becoming more animated and descriptive about mouthwatering foods and drinks the hungrier those nearby are.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Famine is keen to talk about delicacies of every kind, becoming more animated and descriptive about mouthwatering foods and drinks the hungrier those nearby are.

trans-unit.source: Use: The characters are trying to help a group of survivors transport much‑needed food stores to their community when someone all in black on a black motorcycle appears on the road ahead.
trans-unit.target: Use: The characters are trying to help a group of survivors transport much‑needed food stores to their community when someone all in black on a black motorcycle appears on the road ahead.

trans-unit.source: Plague (often called “Death”) is present wherever people die of disease or infirmity brought on by age. She prefers black and pale green evening wear, including long pale green gloves and often a grinning skull mask. When traveling, she drives a pale green hearse or motorcycle, or rides a horse the same sickly green color.
trans-unit.target: Plague (often called “Death”) is present wherever people die of disease or infirmity brought on by age. She prefers black and pale green evening wear, including long pale green gloves and often a grinning skull mask. When traveling, she drives a pale green hearse or motorcycle, or rides a horse the same sickly green color.

trans-unit.source: Environment: Almost anywhere people are dying (but especially of disease and/or old age) and/or with one or more of the Four
trans-unit.target: Environment: Almost anywhere people are dying (but especially of disease and/or old age) and/or with one or more of the Four

trans-unit.source: Movement: Short; usually has a pale green mount or vehicle nearby
trans-unit.target: Movement: Short; usually has a pale green mount or vehicle nearby

trans-unit.source: Combat: When she wishes, Plague wields a scythe, as if she had always been holding it. She attacks twice with it as her action. On a hit, the scythe deals damage and the target must succeed on a Might defense roll. On a failed roll, the target contracts a supernatural disease requiring that they succeed on a Might defense roll each minute or descend one step on the damage track. If an affected target succeeds on three Might defense rolls at any point, they recover. If Plague removes a glove as an action, she can use her next action to imbue her scythe with necrotic power, or simply touch a target with her bare hand. On a hit with either her touch or the imbued scythe, she inflicts damage, and the target must succeed on a Might defense roll or die. Plague can use this ability about once a day, or immediately again if her previous target dies because of it. As one of the Four, Plague can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced death by disease or due to old age.
trans-unit.target: Combat: When she wishes, Plague wields a scythe, as if she had always been holding it. She attacks twice with it as her action. On a hit, the scythe deals damage and the target must succeed on a Might defense roll. On a failed roll, the target contracts a supernatural disease requiring that they succeed on a Might defense roll each minute or descend one step on the damage track. If an affected target succeeds on three Might defense rolls at any point, they recover. If Plague removes a glove as an action, she can use her next action to imbue her scythe with necrotic power, or simply touch a target with her bare hand. On a hit with either her touch or the imbued scythe, she inflicts damage, and the target must succeed on a Might defense roll or die. Plague can use this ability about once a day, or immediately again if her previous target dies because of it. As one of the Four, Plague can see in the dark, regains 1 health each round, and, if killed, reappears within 1d10 days at the next nearest location that previously experienced death by disease or due to old age.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Of all the Four, Plague is the most changeable in outlook, and sometimes is even somewhat sympathetic to humanity’s plight. When she’s in such a mood, persuasive characters could convince Plague to pass them over, though she promises that it’s only a temporary stay of death.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Of all the Four, Plague is the most changeable in outlook, and sometimes is even somewhat sympathetic to humanity’s plight. When she’s in such a mood, persuasive characters could convince Plague to pass them over, though she promises that it’s only a temporary stay of death.

trans-unit.source: Use: The characters find a before‑times bunker filled with corpses killed by some strange infection, plus a living “human” wearing a black and pale green evening gown.
trans-unit.target: Use: The characters find a before‑times bunker filled with corpses killed by some strange infection, plus a living “human” wearing a black and pale green evening gown.

trans-unit.source: Gamma worms hide their large forms by burrowing beneath the ground, and when they emerge on the surface, they cloak themselves behind psychic distortion fields. The only clue someone has that they’re being stalked is a smell of cloves over the stale whiff of death. Unfortunately, if someone smells a gamma worm’s distinctive odor, it’s probably already too late.
trans-unit.target: Gamma worms hide their large forms by burrowing beneath the ground, and when they emerge on the surface, they cloak themselves behind psychic distortion fields. The only clue someone has that they’re being stalked is a smell of cloves over the stale whiff of death. Unfortunately, if someone smells a gamma worm’s distinctive odor, it’s probably already too late.

trans-unit.source: Gamma worms might be the result of military research, radioactive mutation, or aliens or other strange intruders seeking to eradicate human life as part of their terraforming efforts to change Earth to their liking.
trans-unit.target: Gamma worms might be the result of military research, radioactive mutation, or aliens or other strange intruders seeking to eradicate human life as part of their terraforming efforts to change Earth to their liking.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Hunger for flesh; eliminate humans
trans-unit.target: Motive: Hunger for flesh; eliminate humans

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Stealth as level 8 when psychic field active; Speed defense as level 5 due to size; ability to see through tricks as level 4
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Stealth as level 8 when psychic field active; Speed defense as level 5 due to size; ability to see through tricks as level 4

trans-unit.source: Combat: Gamma worms attack twice each round with blades they unfold from their wormlike lengths. Alternatively, about once each hour a gamma worm can unleash a hail of gamma spikes against up to three targets within short range. Targets struck by the spikes take damage and must succeed on a Might defense roll or fall unconscious. Unconscious targets wake up a few rounds later feeling dizzy and slightly sick to their stomach—they’ve developed radiation sickness.
trans-unit.target: Combat: Gamma worms attack twice each round with blades they unfold from their wormlike lengths. Alternatively, about once each hour a gamma worm can unleash a hail of gamma spikes against up to three targets within short range. Targets struck by the spikes take damage and must succeed on a Might defense roll or fall unconscious. Unconscious targets wake up a few rounds later feeling dizzy and slightly sick to their stomach—they’ve developed radiation sickness.

trans-unit.source: Gamma worms can use their action to generate a psychic field that effectively grants them invisibility. The invisibility lasts until they attack or move more than an immediate distance on their turn.
trans-unit.target: Gamma worms can use their action to generate a psychic field that effectively grants them invisibility. The invisibility lasts until they attack or move more than an immediate distance on their turn.

trans-unit.source: Gamma worms are vulnerable to cold; in chilly conditions, their Speed defense is hindered by four steps. In addition, cold attacks ignore their Armor.
trans-unit.target: Gamma worms are vulnerable to cold; in chilly conditions, their Speed defense is hindered by four steps. In addition, cold attacks ignore their Armor.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Gamma worms act like prey driven monsters, but they may have a secret language and purpose (if aliens placed them on Earth to hasten the apocalypse or kill survivors in the post apocalyptic world).
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Gamma worms act like prey driven monsters, but they may have a secret language and purpose (if aliens placed them on Earth to hasten the apocalypse or kill survivors in the post apocalyptic world).

trans-unit.source: Use: Irradiated and hungry gamma worms emerge from the ruins to hunt fresh meat in outlying communities.
trans-unit.target: Use: Irradiated and hungry gamma worms emerge from the ruins to hunt fresh meat in outlying communities.

trans-unit.source: Radiation born mutant roaches are terrible individually, but absolutely horrible in swarms. Many times the size of roaches in the before times, these firefly like creatures prefer dark areas, such as ruined subways and abandoned basements.
trans-unit.target: Radiation born mutant roaches are terrible individually, but absolutely horrible in swarms. Many times the size of roaches in the before times, these firefly like creatures prefer dark areas, such as ruined subways and abandoned basements.

trans-unit.source: Some swarms are rumored to have an insidious group intelligence, one that is utterly inimical to humankind.
trans-unit.target: Some swarms are rumored to have an insidious group intelligence, one that is utterly inimical to humankind.

trans-unit.source: Environment: Anywhere dark, usually in nests of four to ten (or more)
trans-unit.target: Environment: Anywhere dark, usually in nests of four to ten (or more)

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 3 due to small size; perception as level 5
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 3 due to small size; perception as level 5

trans-unit.source: Combat: A glowing roach attacks with radioactive mandibles. When four glowing roaches act together, they can make a single attack as a level 4 creature inflicting 4 points of damage. Targets damaged by a group of glowing roaches must also succeed on a difficulty 4 Might defense task or face additional consequences from the effects of radiation and slashing mandibles, as determined on the Glowing Roach Effects table. The effects are cumulative and last until a target makes a recovery roll.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A glowing roach attacks with radioactive mandibles. When four glowing roaches act together, they can make a single attack as a level 4 creature inflicting 4 points of damage. Targets damaged by a group of glowing roaches must also succeed on a difficulty 4 Might defense task or face additional consequences from the effects of radiation and slashing mandibles, as determined on the Glowing Roach Effects table. The effects are cumulative and last until a target makes a recovery roll.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes a single glowing roach mutates further, allowing it to grow into a 20 foot (6 m) long monstrosity. Thankfully, these monstrous glowing roaches are rare and seldom come out into the light.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes a single glowing roach mutates further, allowing it to grow into a 20 foot (6 m) long monstrosity. Thankfully, these monstrous glowing roaches are rare and seldom come out into the light.

trans-unit.source: Roaches dislike bright illumination: in sunlight or other bright light, glowing roach attacks are hindered.
trans-unit.target: Roaches dislike bright illumination: in sunlight or other bright light, glowing roach attacks are hindered.

trans-unit.source: *Monstrous glowing roach: level 5, Speed defense as level 4; Armor 2; mandible attack inflicts 7 damage and results in a check on the Glowing Roach Effects table
trans-unit.target: *Monstrous glowing roach: level 5, Speed defense as level 4; Armor 2; mandible attack inflicts 7 damage and results in a check on the Glowing Roach Effects table

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Glowing roaches almost always react like voracious insects, despite their size. That is, except for swarms of ten or more, which act like sapient creatures. Sapient swarms may try to lure survivors, possibly even spelling out human readable letters in the sand that anonymously ask for help or promise it. But it’s a ruse; they despise humans for all the ways people used to exterminate roaches in the before times.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Glowing roaches almost always react like voracious insects, despite their size. That is, except for swarms of ten or more, which act like sapient creatures. Sapient swarms may try to lure survivors, possibly even spelling out human readable letters in the sand that anonymously ask for help or promise it. But it’s a ruse; they despise humans for all the ways people used to exterminate roaches in the before times.

trans-unit.source: Use: A visit to a ruined hospital or airport scares up a few glowing roaches when light is introduced to a dark place.
trans-unit.target: Use: A visit to a ruined hospital or airport scares up a few glowing roaches when light is introduced to a dark place.

trans-unit.source: 1 Head wound: Intellect defense tasks hindered
trans-unit.target: 1 Head wound: Intellect defense tasks hindered

trans-unit.source: 2 Wounded leg: Speed defense tasks hindered
trans-unit.target: 2 Wounded leg: Speed defense tasks hindered

trans-unit.source: 3 Gut wound: Might defense tasks hindered
trans-unit.target: 3 Gut wound: Might defense tasks hindered

trans-unit.source: 4 Spit in eye: Perception tasks hindered
trans-unit.target: 4 Spit in eye: Perception tasks hindered

trans-unit.source: 6 Lingering radioactive effect: Refer to Radiation in the Real World and possibly Incredible Mutations if your game has such fantastic elements.
trans-unit.target: 6 Lingering radioactive effect: Refer to Radiation in the Real World and possibly Incredible Mutations if your game has such fantastic elements.

trans-unit.source: Hooked blossoms germinate almost like regular plants but can root even on constructed surfaces, including cement and sometimes metal. Rooted juveniles display pinkish flowers—which some equate to the color of an open wound—that give off an alluring perfume.
trans-unit.target: Hooked blossoms germinate almost like regular plants but can root even on constructed surfaces, including cement and sometimes metal. Rooted juveniles display pinkish flowers—which some equate to the color of an open wound—that give off an alluring perfume.

trans-unit.source: If they mature, they uproot themselves, revealing an ambulatory body plated in a dull grey metallic hide and limbs that end in a single hook like digit.
trans-unit.target: If they mature, they uproot themselves, revealing an ambulatory body plated in a dull grey metallic hide and limbs that end in a single hook like digit.

trans-unit.source: Both forms are dangerous. The most common variety of rooted blossoms work in small groups to cook prey with focused beams of microwave energy. Ambulatory versions are about the size of large domestic cats. They use their sharp limbs to hook themselves into a target, then use their flowers to cook their prey or, alternatively, put them to sleep for later consumption.
trans-unit.target: Both forms are dangerous. The most common variety of rooted blossoms work in small groups to cook prey with focused beams of microwave energy. Ambulatory versions are about the size of large domestic cats. They use their sharp limbs to hook themselves into a target, then use their flowers to cook their prey or, alternatively, put them to sleep for later consumption.

trans-unit.source: Juvenile, rooted blossom: level 1; Armor 1; a group of five flowers attacks with a level 3 microwave ray inflicting 3 ambient damage
trans-unit.target: Juvenile, rooted blossom: level 1; Armor 1; a group of five flowers attacks with a level 3 microwave ray inflicting 3 ambient damage

trans-unit.source: Environment: In groups of five or more anyplace touched by radiation, mutation, or AI genetic‑nanotech engineering
trans-unit.target: Environment: In groups of five or more anyplace touched by radiation, mutation, or AI genetic‑nanotech engineering

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 4 due to size; disguise as level 6 when not moving
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Speed defense as level 4 due to size; disguise as level 6 when not moving

trans-unit.source: Combat: A mature blossom attacks twice with its hooks, inflicting damage with each strike. If a blossom hitsa target, the target must succeed on a second Speed defense roll, which is hindered. On a failed roll, the blossom hooks itself to the target until the target can detach the blossom with a successful Might roll as their action. Each round a blossom is hooked to a target, the target automatically takes 3 points of ambient damage from microwave energy emitted by the creature’s bloom. Some varieties of hooked blossoms produce soporific pollen (treat as poison) instead of microwaves. If a character is hooked by one of these blossoms, they must instead succeed on an Intellect defense roll each round they remain hooked, or fall asleep. A sleeping target must be roused by an ally or suffer physical damage to wake. Each round a target remains asleep, they automatically take 3 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor). In its juvenile, rooted form, a hooked blossom resembles a flower with a metallic stem, which is dangerous when active. In direct sunlight, a rooted hooked blossom regains 1 point of health each round.
trans-unit.target: Combat: A mature blossom attacks twice with its hooks, inflicting damage with each strike. If a blossom hitsa target, the target must succeed on a second Speed defense roll, which is hindered. On a failed roll, the blossom hooks itself to the target until the target can detach the blossom with a successful Might roll as their action. Each round a blossom is hooked to a target, the target automatically takes 3 points of ambient damage from microwave energy emitted by the creature’s bloom. Some varieties of hooked blossoms produce soporific pollen (treat as poison) instead of microwaves. If a character is hooked by one of these blossoms, they must instead succeed on an Intellect defense roll each round they remain hooked, or fall asleep. A sleeping target must be roused by an ally or suffer physical damage to wake. Each round a target remains asleep, they automatically take 3 points of Intellect damage (ignores Armor). In its juvenile, rooted form, a hooked blossom resembles a flower with a metallic stem, which is dangerous when active. In direct sunlight, a rooted hooked blossom regains 1 point of health each round.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: Hooked blossoms act much like animal predators, though they are not concerned with self‑preservation.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: Hooked blossoms act much like animal predators, though they are not concerned with self‑preservation.

trans-unit.source: Use: The scavenging PCs spy a flower‑clad hill in the distance, shining in the sun. Even from here, they can smell the pleasant perfume drifting on the breeze.
trans-unit.target: Use: The scavenging PCs spy a flower‑clad hill in the distance, shining in the sun. Even from here, they can smell the pleasant perfume drifting on the breeze.

trans-unit.source: Survivors assume the melted are another strain of mutants. Maybe so, but they’re not originally from Earth. Or rather, not this Earth. The melted leaked in from a parallel world’s apocalypse caused by a snafu with a high energy supercollider. Dozens of different but parallel timelines smashed into each other. The few survivors were fused beings composed of many different alternate versions of the same person, each still “radioactive” with latent transdimensional energy.
trans-unit.target: Survivors assume the melted are another strain of mutants. Maybe so, but they’re not originally from Earth. Or rather, not this Earth. The melted leaked in from a parallel world’s apocalypse caused by a snafu with a high energy supercollider. Dozens of different but parallel timelines smashed into each other. The few survivors were fused beings composed of many different alternate versions of the same person, each still “radioactive” with latent transdimensional energy.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Surcease from constant pain; absorb more sapient beings
trans-unit.target: Motive: Surcease from constant pain; absorb more sapient beings

trans-unit.source: Environment: Groups of three to five roaming the ruins
trans-unit.target: Environment: Groups of three to five roaming the ruins

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Initiative and Speed defense as level 5 due to seeing a second into the future
trans-unit.target: Modifications: Initiative and Speed defense as level 5 due to seeing a second into the future

trans-unit.source: Combat: The melted attack with two claws.
trans-unit.target: Combat: The melted attack with two claws.

trans-unit.source: If a melted defeats a foe, they “consume” it by drawing it fully into their body cavity as their action, healing the melted for 10 health and giving the creature a few hours free of pain, allowing their mind to clear.
trans-unit.target: If a melted defeats a foe, they “consume” it by drawing it fully into their body cavity as their action, healing the melted for 10 health and giving the creature a few hours free of pain, allowing their mind to clear.

trans-unit.source: A given melted may also have a trait associated with the transdimensional energy they burn with.
trans-unit.target: A given melted may also have a trait associated with the transdimensional energy they burn with.

trans-unit.source: Interaction: A few of the melted gain moments of clarity, but all are burdened with anguish stemming from their fused state. They unleash their full fury on whoever and whatever they catch among the ruins, but they seem particularly bent on finding and absorbing scientists.
trans-unit.target: Interaction: A few of the melted gain moments of clarity, but all are burdened with anguish stemming from their fused state. They unleash their full fury on whoever and whatever they catch among the ruins, but they seem particularly bent on finding and absorbing scientists.

trans-unit.source: Use: A group of the melted seek out a surviving scientific installation and attempt to consume everyone nearby.
trans-unit.target: Use: A group of the melted seek out a surviving scientific installation and attempt to consume everyone nearby.

trans-unit.source: Loot: One out of three melted may carry a manifest cypher (in the form of before times military tech), such as an armor reinforcer or a sonic detonation.
trans-unit.target: Loot: One out of three melted may carry a manifest cypher (in the form of before times military tech), such as an armor reinforcer or a sonic detonation.

trans-unit.source: 1 Enhanced strength: Attacks inflict 6 points of damage (instead of 4)
trans-unit.target: 1 Enhanced strength: Attacks inflict 6 points of damage (instead of 4)

trans-unit.source: 2 Healing factor: Regains 2 health each round
trans-unit.target: 2 Healing factor: Regains 2 health each round

trans-unit.source: 3 Bite: In addition to their claw attacks, makes a bit attack each round that inflicts 6 points of damage
trans-unit.target: 3 Bite: In addition to their claw attacks, makes a bit attack each round that inflicts 6 points of damage

trans-unit.source: 4 Gravitic repulsion: Flies a long distance each round
trans-unit.target: 4 Gravitic repulsion: Flies a long distance each round

trans-unit.source: 5 Dimensional instability: Teleports up to a long distance before or after each attack
trans-unit.target: 5 Dimensional instability: Teleports up to a long distance before or after each attack

trans-unit.source: 6 Transdimensional blast: About once each hour, emits transdimensional energy filling an adjacent short area; all creatures in the area take 6 points of ambient damage on a failed Might defense roll, as parts of them temporarily fuse with other affect creatures, or creatures in alternate dimensions
trans-unit.target: 6 Transdimensional blast: About once each hour, emits transdimensional energy filling an adjacent short area; all creatures in the area take 6 points of ambient damage on a failed Might defense roll, as parts of them temporarily fuse with other affect creatures, or creatures in alternate dimensions

trans-unit.source: Exposure to radiation and other mutagens—or possibly the malign design of some before times military lab or inscrutable AI instance—transformed an already large and aggressive bear into something truly horrific. Standing well over 20 feet (6 m) tall, radioactive bears are drawn to radioactive areas, which empower and sustain them, though not completely. Which is why sometimes they head into uncontaminated areas to hunt large game. They especially prefer people.
trans-unit.target: Exposure to radiation and other mutagens—or possibly the malign design of some before times military lab or inscrutable AI instance—transformed an already large and aggressive bear into something truly horrific. Standing well over 20 feet (6 m) tall, radioactive bears are drawn to radioactive areas, which empower and sustain them, though not completely. Which is why sometimes they head into uncontaminated areas to hunt large game. They especially prefer people.

trans-unit.source: Motive: Hunger for flesh and radiation
trans-unit.target: Motive: Hunger for flesh and radiation

trans-unit.source: Modifications: Speed defense as level 4 due to size; perception as level 8
